Be a bit more explicit about the plugin generation

Make the warning in the auto-generated file stand-out a bit more, so
people don't waste time trying to add entries that appear
automatically.

commit_message:
Remove constraints envs from tox.ini

The constraints environments are not used at all, they have been
obsoleted everywhere in OpenStack. Remove them completely.

Now the normal jobs can use constraints - as magnum already does.

Change-Id: Iecec444fba59923c7894c1fd2a90aebbfdc4724d

commit_message:
Support "--pre-delete" argument for hook-clear

This changes:
1. Add "--pre-delete" argument for cmd "heat hook-clear" to
clear pre-delete hooks.
2. Add "--pre-delete" argument for osc cmd
"openstack stack hook clear" to clear pre-delete hooks.
3. Support to poll pre-delete hooks for "heat hook-poll" and
"openstack stack hook poll".

Change-Id: Ic5a6e1b7588e3f9ad49eaaf8085f18ec74fc629e
Closes-Bug: #1567814

subject: Fix post jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-17 15:08:22.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/a6/a6650650f065bc4423568f9318d362957eba7f31/post/magnum-docs/60418d4/
http://logs.openstack.org/a6/a6650650f065bc4423568f9318d362957eba7f31/post/magnum-branch-tarball/415035c/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this.

Change-Id: Iad81b47899c4554b75f90dc24f0aa2aff7aef730
'}]
commit_message:
Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See
http://logs.openstack.org/a6/a6650650f065bc4423568f9318d362957eba7f31/post/magnum-docs/60418d4/
http://logs.openstack.org/a6/a6650650f065bc4423568f9318d362957eba7f31/post/magnum-branch-tarball/415035c/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this.

Change-Id: Iad81b47899c4554b75f90dc24f0aa2aff7aef730

subject: Ignore the filter_service_activity option if gnocchi project not found
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-15 02:57:58.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/dispatcher/test_gnocchi.py', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': 'Ignore the filter_service_activity option if gnocchi project not found

When use gnocchi as meter dispatcher, if we didn't created gnocchi project
and config the filter_service_activity as True (default value),
ceilometer-collector will repeatedly try to get the "gnocchi" project,
many NotFound error will be recorded in log file. This change ignore the
filter_service_activity if gnocchi project didn't created.

Change-Id: I53b0cfbf8dd9dfc3f750ea2ab41d33a0f58d7234
Closes-Bug: #1570174
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore the filter_service_activity option if gnocchi project not found

When use gnocchi as meter dispatcher, if we didn't created gnocchi project
and config the filter_service_activity as True (default value),
ceilometer-collector will repeatedly try to get the "gnocchi" project,
many NotFound error will be recorded in log file. This change ignore the
filter_service_activity if gnocchi project didn't created.

Change-Id: I53b0cfbf8dd9dfc3f750ea2ab41d33a0f58d7234
Closes-Bug: #1570174

commit_message:
Add default vagrant box in config.yaml.sample

1. motivation
  It is easy for new user to run openstack:
  a. mv config.yaml.sample
  b. vagrant up

2. what's change
  a. add official vagrant box
  b. add default memory/cpu
  c. add hiera_config_path since official vagrant box complain it
  d. enable private ip address

Change-Id: I1bb889b0d243042609e63030a6406fb805065d1e
Signed-off-by: Ruijing Guo <ruijing.guo@intel.com>

subject: Add logging to cli if keystone.conf is not found
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 19985, 'name': 'Ryosuke Mizuno', 'email': 'r-mizuno@rs.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'r-mizuno'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-17 21:47:55.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cmd/cli.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py'], 'message': "Add logging to cli if keystone.conf is not found

If keystone.conf is not found at one of ./etc/keystone.conf,
~/.keystone/keystone.conf, ~/keystone.conf,
/etc/keystone/keystone.conf, or /etc/keystone.conf, the keystone-manage
command will use defaults configured in keystone.common.config[1] (or
elsewhere, e.g. keystone.common.sql.core[2]). If it does not find a
default value for a parameter it needs to use, it will error at that
point (for example, the samp_idp_metadata command errors when
idp_entity_id is not set). However, if all of the parameters it is
using have default values, which is the case for commands like db_sync
and ssl_setup, keystone-manage will silently proceed with those
defaults. This is not obvious to the user, who may have misplaced the
keystone.conf or is lacking permissions to read keystone.conf. This
patch adds a warning that will notify the user if it can't find the
config file, but otherwise proceeds as normal.

Why not fix this in oslo.config? The behavior of silently continuing if
config files aren't found is longstanding, so changing that behavior
would probably not be backwards-compatible. Moreover, other projects
might want to handle this differently or not handle it at all.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/config.py
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/sql/core.py#n73

Closes-bug: #1273273

Change-Id: I276c671a0da78e3d1d2aa7336e55f65be41d8cca
"}]
commit_message:
Add logging to cli if keystone.conf is not found

If keystone.conf is not found at one of ./etc/keystone.conf,
~/.keystone/keystone.conf, ~/keystone.conf,
/etc/keystone/keystone.conf, or /etc/keystone.conf, the keystone-manage
command will use defaults configured in keystone.common.config[1] (or
elsewhere, e.g. keystone.common.sql.core[2]). If it does not find a
default value for a parameter it needs to use, it will error at that
point (for example, the samp_idp_metadata command errors when
idp_entity_id is not set). However, if all of the parameters it is
using have default values, which is the case for commands like db_sync
and ssl_setup, keystone-manage will silently proceed with those
defaults. This is not obvious to the user, who may have misplaced the
keystone.conf or is lacking permissions to read keystone.conf. This
patch adds a warning that will notify the user if it can't find the
config file, but otherwise proceeds as normal.

Why not fix this in oslo.config? The behavior of silently continuing if
config files aren't found is longstanding, so changing that behavior
would probably not be backwards-compatible. Moreover, other projects
might want to handle this differently or not handle it at all.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/config.py
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/sql/core.py#n73

Closes-bug: #1273273

Change-Id: I276c671a0da78e3d1d2aa7336e55f65be41d8cca

Refactor domain config upload

This gets the code ready for a change that will allow us to know if, and
how many, config files get uploaded.

Related-Bug: #1472059
Change-Id: I8f4f6dbb58f24a41026be2c2624316cc350a2ea8

subject: Ignore negative suffix-byte-range requests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-16 00:24:11.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py'], 'message': 'Ignore negative suffix-byte-range requests.

If the client asked for "Range: bytes=--123", Swift would respond with
a 206 and a Content-Length of -123. Now that Range header is ignored
just like all kinds of other invalid Range headers.

Change-Id: I30d4522d223076ce342d20c52f57ff0eb2aea1f4
Closes-Bug: 1571106
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore negative suffix-byte-range requests.

If the client asked for "Range: bytes=--123", Swift would respond with
a 206 and a Content-Length of -123. Now that Range header is ignored
just like all kinds of other invalid Range headers.

Change-Id: I30d4522d223076ce342d20c52f57ff0eb2aea1f4
Closes-Bug: 1571106

subject: [install-guide] Aodh should use mysql as its backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-16 02:47:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/ceilometer-aodh.rst'], 'message': "[install-guide] Aodh should use mysql as its backend

In install manual, now we set mongodb as Aodh's backend in
its configration file, while we set up its database in mysql.
Aodh's support for mongodb as its backend seems to be deprecated,
so we should use mysql instead.

Change-Id: I2aa918ed9ac68ac309dcf6401dfa802723ecd172
"}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Aodh should use mysql as its backend

In install manual, now we set mongodb as Aodh's backend in
its configration file, while we set up its database in mysql.
Aodh's support for mongodb as its backend seems to be deprecated,
so we should use mysql instead.

Change-Id: I2aa918ed9ac68ac309dcf6401dfa802723ecd172

commit_message:
Revert "functional: Update ref used from ovs branch-2.5."

This reverts commit 59b36ecca8f60996a60cd52f816573ace9b39309.

I have a strong suspicion that ovs 2.5 contains something that doesn't
play nice with ryu native interface and it caused bug 1567668. I propose
to revert back to original commit hash that currently contains all we
need and it may unblock check queues.

Related-Bug: 1567668

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-15 08:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/utils.py', 'murano/api/v1/cloudfoundry/cfapi.py'], 'message': 'Use unified decorator for retries

To make our code consistent will be better to use one decorator for all
operations which require retry on exceptions. RetryDecorator from
oslo_service is operated with green threads and probably is not a best
choice for the decorator of retry operations in murano. An obsolete
custom retry decorator was removed too.

Closes-Bug: 1559890
Change-Id: I7b1d0675e5628769d7e618d7b6118478039ac2db
'}]
commit_message:
Use unified decorator for retries

To make our code consistent will be better to use one decorator for all
operations which require retry on exceptions. RetryDecorator from
oslo_service is operated with green threads and probably is not a best
choice for the decorator of retry operations in murano. An obsolete
custom retry decorator was removed too.

Closes-Bug: 1559890
Change-Id: I7b1d0675e5628769d7e618d7b6118478039ac2db

commit_message:
Fix error on deleting Magnum App

Currently Murano fails to delete Magnum bay due to missing
bay_ident attribute in case when Magnum bay status is CREATE_FAILED.
This patch fixs this issue.

Change-Id: Iecbd0464bd8839f1a9f9ce428d7eaa1e130c9b2d
Closes-bug: #1566725

subject: Added deprecation warning for lbaas agent.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 11:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/server.pp'], 'message': 'Added deprecation warning for lbaas agent.

Using the parameter to install the lbaas agent on the neutron
server should be avoided. If the user wants to install the lbaas
agent on the neutron server they should be using the lbaas agent
class. This change adds a deprecation warning with information
to the user on the proper way of installing the lbaas agent.

I have updated the comment for the parameter as the lbaas agent
is not required by neutron server to enable the lbaas service plugin.

Change-Id: I23bdb1385e9ff3e7218bf4c05f229cce4caf2504
'}]
commit_message:
Added deprecation warning for lbaas agent.

Using the parameter to install the lbaas agent on the neutron
server should be avoided. If the user wants to install the lbaas
agent on the neutron server they should be using the lbaas agent
class. This change adds a deprecation warning with information
to the user on the proper way of installing the lbaas agent.

I have updated the comment for the parameter as the lbaas agent
is not required by neutron server to enable the lbaas service plugin.

Change-Id: I23bdb1385e9ff3e7218bf4c05f229cce4caf2504

commit_message:
Don't reset HOME in redstack

Currently redstack resets HOME as the first thing that it does. It
isn't particlularly apparent why this is required; it may have been
needed in a long ago time when paths to thing were
trove-integrations/scripts relative but they aren't now.

Change-Id: If0f7329ea37f6d92f10b815c7a96eaee97d8b6d4
Closes-Bug: #1552048

commit_message:
DVR: rebind port if ofport changes

When binding is called in DVR, check to see if the port was
previously wired under a different ofport. If it was, first
unbind the old port and then bind the new one.

Change-Id: I372158c4a6986295e396d849a2c9c5372b271e08
Closes-Bug: #1562467
(cherry picked from commit 4731dbbef1f615b9ce6d18315e8ca9810e8a772d)

commit_message:
ovsfw: Load vlan tag from other_config

OVS agent stores vlan tag only to other_config before
setup_port_filter() is called [1], leaving 'tag' column empty. This
patch loads tag from correct place and modifies functional tests
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: 1566934
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/1efed3a5321a259d27ec4a6e80352d35fc423c11/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L821

Change-Id: Iaae46ce7362fedfc53af958600d6d712eb382e9f
(cherry picked from commit dabd969090d35ec218d348f170edbef58163a79d)

commit_message:
Hide package_counter in case of using glare

It is now impossible to display the correct number of packages in
each category using glare as a package storage, because glare
doesn't store this information. Therefore, it is better to just
hide counters from the user until package count will be implemented
in Glare.

Change-Id: I62487dbb12b1d104d293dcc499ded216982e0159
Related-bug: #1537070
(cherry picked from commit 6ff16698c839b4c0f7d3488f866bbc3e8db87ae5)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-02 22:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/api.py'], 'message': "Stop using tpool with oslo_db

oslo_db no longer supports the 'use_tpool' configuration option and
we see a warnings to that effect [1] whenever we run unit tests.

This commit modifies the cinder db api so that when in interacts
with oslo_db it no longer uses the db_concurrency.TpoolDbapiWrapper
and thereby avoids setting the 'use_tpool' configuration option.

[1] oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:241: NotSupportedWarning:
    Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported


Change-Id: I4e7fcc8fe86a1a22224c929e42bdf765e25131c8
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using tpool with oslo_db

oslo_db no longer supports the 'use_tpool' configuration option and
we see a warnings to that effect [1] whenever we run unit tests.

This commit modifies the cinder db api so that when in interacts
with oslo_db it no longer uses the db_concurrency.TpoolDbapiWrapper
and thereby avoids setting the 'use_tpool' configuration option.

[1] oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:241: NotSupportedWarning:
    Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported


Change-Id: I4e7fcc8fe86a1a22224c929e42bdf765e25131c8

After this patch is merged, docker registry will be available.
We can push docker images into local repo on a bay node.

subject: Update Kube version for latest image
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-09 17:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/kubecluster.yaml', 'magnum/templates/kubernetes/kubecluster-coreos.yaml'], 'message': 'Update Kube version for latest image

New image on 4/5 has Kube version 1.2.0

For Kubernetes bay, the scheduler, controller and proxy
are run from container, not from Kube binaries in the
image.  The version for these containers are currently
hardcoded in the Heat template as 1.0.6, so update to
the new version 1.2.0.  Otherwise, the scheduler and
kubelet would not work properly with the mixed versions.

There is a patch under review to expose the Kube version
as a label:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295655/

Implements: blueprint atomic23
Change-Id: I46be4038b62be202ba670749e0a5c6663eeb12d3
'}]
commit_message:
Update Kube version for latest image

New image on 4/5 has Kube version 1.2.0

For Kubernetes bay, the scheduler, controller and proxy
are run from container, not from Kube binaries in the
image.  The version for these containers are currently
hardcoded in the Heat template as 1.0.6, so update to
the new version 1.2.0.  Otherwise, the scheduler and
kubelet would not work properly with the mixed versions.

There is a patch under review to expose the Kube version
as a label:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/295655/

Implements: blueprint atomic23
Change-Id: I46be4038b62be202ba670749e0a5c6663eeb12d3

commit_message:
Use k8sclient library

In Ia400b5b6919753d6241233a6666a2c30c7618bc9, we are
adding a new library to global requirements. This
python-k8sclient library essentially has the same
code that was in Magnum so it's a straight replace.

Change-Id: Ib85bcf532e4163d5c1ac95ef701a1ec3133b69eb

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-20 15:39:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': 'Test: use assert_has_calls() instead

Some of the assertions in cinder test are sequential, should better
use assert_has_calls() instead of assert_any_call().
And assert_has_calls() provide more clear messages in case of failure.

Change-Id: I66d74d1b84f939eb02d00c6f84813beb7e7311e4
'}]
commit_message:
Test: use assert_has_calls() instead

Some of the assertions in cinder test are sequential, should better
use assert_has_calls() instead of assert_any_call().
And assert_has_calls() provide more clear messages in case of failure.

Change-Id: I66d74d1b84f939eb02d00c6f84813beb7e7311e4

Clean up cinder race fix

cinder volumes script.

commit_message:
This patch implements security group app

we leverage ovs's conjunction mechanism to
map security group rules to conjunction id
in order to install less flow entries
Things left to be done:
1.implement port update
2.test code will be uploaded in another patch

Change-Id: Ia1f311ec68085f911fcbf50121a3dbe988826316
Implements: blueprint security-group-dragonflow-driver

subject: Make two Trove scenario tests part of the check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-16 14:08:18.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make two Trove scenario tests part of the check

This change proposes to move two of the Trove scenario tests that were
being run in experimental to the check. These tests pass, but not
reliably. The failures are now largely related to timeouts and these
are being addressed in[1], other false-negatives which were seen
earlier have been now addressed.

Since these are now in the check (and no longer experimental) the
branches where they will run has been restricted to master, and moving
forward, newton, ocata, etc., The stability of the tests in mitaka is
not sufficient to make it worthwhile running there, and the tests are
not complete in earlier releases.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1571092

Change-Id: I9135544e5c97ad9f129945006cc5b16a70d617e4
'}]
commit_message:
Make two Trove scenario tests part of the check

This change proposes to move two of the Trove scenario tests that were
being run in experimental to the check. These tests pass, but not
reliably. The failures are now largely related to timeouts and these
are being addressed in[1], other false-negatives which were seen
earlier have been now addressed.

Since these are now in the check (and no longer experimental) the
branches where they will run has been restricted to master, and moving
forward, newton, ocata, etc., The stability of the tests in mitaka is
not sufficient to make it worthwhile running there, and the tests are
not complete in earlier releases.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove/+bug/1571092

Change-Id: I9135544e5c97ad9f129945006cc5b16a70d617e4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-16 15:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/kolla.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Change kolla gate timeout to 90 minutes"

I'm not realy sure what the problem is with our gate timing out,
but 90 minutes doesn't fix the problem.  It just prolongs the delay
for gating when the gate fails in some mysterious way.

Thanks for working with us while we sort out our gating situation.

This reverts commit 01155c491b0b5e6abb27e2a06181ea4a59cc5eba.

Change-Id: I45ff5b59697d949e2c9ea8412442b4649486b2ea
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Change kolla gate timeout to 90 minutes"

I'm not realy sure what the problem is with our gate timing out,
but 90 minutes doesn't fix the problem.  It just prolongs the delay
for gating when the gate fails in some mysterious way.

Thanks for working with us while we sort out our gating situation.

This reverts commit 01155c491b0b5e6abb27e2a06181ea4a59cc5eba.

Change-Id: I45ff5b59697d949e2c9ea8412442b4649486b2ea

commit_message:
Do not check deleted tasks before deployment

After soft deletion was introduced for tasks the task
manager's logic of telling whether there are any in-progress
tasks for a specific clusters got wrong.

This patch changes TaskCollection to not take deleted
tasks into account.

Closes-bug: #1561942
Change-Id: Iafacba2acd80cc32a514ef337ddd39699820c4ab

subject: Fix failures in Juno to Kilo upgrade script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 15:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/lxc-containers-create-upgrade-step-2.yml', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/lxc-containers-create-upgrade-step-3.yml', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/scripts/juno-container-cleanup.sh', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/lxc-containers-create-upgrade-step-1.yml'], 'message': "Fix failures in Juno to Kilo upgrade script

ba6255bc3c67beed6a2f3e8c4f0ad8758e51d16c introduces a bug which results
in the playbook lxc-containers-create.yml not being run on a number of
containers. The function run_lock in run-upgrade.sh prevents a playbook
from being run more than once. The playbook lxc-containers-create.yml is
run three times with --limit to control the order in which containers
are updated. The result is that only the first occurrance of
lxc-containers-create.yml is executed.

This commit creates three wrapper playbooks for
lxc-containers-create.yml so that run_lock treats them as separate
actions.

235c2b29be7fa4777a455377f401066e557c9f21 introduced a new playbook to
clean up MariaDB apt sources. The playbook targets the wrong directory,
'/etc/apt/repos.d/' when it should be '/etc/apt/sources.list.d'. In
addition, the playbook is run before all the new containers have been
created and so fails.

This commit moves the MariaDB clean up into juno-container-cleanup.sh so
that it is located with the other related clean up actions. As with the
other steps in that script, it now ignores failures when removing the
MariaDB source on the assumption that the failures are due to non-
existant containers. In addition the path to search is changed to
'/etc/apt/sources.list.d'. Finally the command is now also applied to
physical hosts in addition to containers.

Change-Id: Ia57d18e09a7df30bf9cbbb5d77177ae7e8003832
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failures in Juno to Kilo upgrade script

ba6255bc3c67beed6a2f3e8c4f0ad8758e51d16c introduces a bug which results
in the playbook lxc-containers-create.yml not being run on a number of
containers. The function run_lock in run-upgrade.sh prevents a playbook
from being run more than once. The playbook lxc-containers-create.yml is
run three times with --limit to control the order in which containers
are updated. The result is that only the first occurrance of
lxc-containers-create.yml is executed.

This commit creates three wrapper playbooks for
lxc-containers-create.yml so that run_lock treats them as separate
actions.

235c2b29be7fa4777a455377f401066e557c9f21 introduced a new playbook to
clean up MariaDB apt sources. The playbook targets the wrong directory,
'/etc/apt/repos.d/' when it should be '/etc/apt/sources.list.d'. In
addition, the playbook is run before all the new containers have been
created and so fails.

This commit moves the MariaDB clean up into juno-container-cleanup.sh so
that it is located with the other related clean up actions. As with the
other steps in that script, it now ignores failures when removing the
MariaDB source on the assumption that the failures are due to non-
existant containers. In addition the path to search is changed to
'/etc/apt/sources.list.d'. Finally the command is now also applied to
physical hosts in addition to containers.

Change-Id: Ia57d18e09a7df30bf9cbbb5d77177ae7e8003832

commit_message:
Update SSL key / cert distribution for Horizon

Following on the changes introduced by I98bcd17dac9a47cc19e0d9ec90176945a6d7e355

This patch updates the SSL key and cert distribution for Horizon to
use slurp & references the primary node in horizon_ssl_key_distribute.yml
when referencing the key and cert facts.

backport for 5838bfdb6b147afc2463de6c2bbbc749386e519d

Change-Id: I11c766acc087ca5f241adc69585c92c17a6f8330
Signed-off-by: Javeria Khan <javeriak@plumgrid.com>

subject: Fix KeyError when rename to a name is already in use
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 17:57:42.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/resource/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/resource/test_core.py'], 'message': "Fix KeyError when rename to a name is already in use

When a user attempts to rename a project via the PATCH
v3/projects/{project_id} API, and the new name is already in-use, rather
than return a nice error explaining that the name is in use, keystone
blows up and raises `KeyError: 'is_domain'` in
_generate_project_name_conflict_msg.

Change-Id: I56fcd8fe1258e2d1de3e541144649ef619f86a7b
Closes-bug: #1565108
(cherry picked from commit c1be6883f250e6bc0ad1b43eb516186f74a477f1)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError when rename to a name is already in use

When a user attempts to rename a project via the PATCH
v3/projects/{project_id} API, and the new name is already in-use, rather
than return a nice error explaining that the name is in use, keystone
blows up and raises `KeyError: 'is_domain'` in
_generate_project_name_conflict_msg.

Change-Id: I56fcd8fe1258e2d1de3e541144649ef619f86a7b
Closes-bug: #1565108
(cherry picked from commit c1be6883f250e6bc0ad1b43eb516186f74a477f1)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-16 20:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Deprecation reason for domain_id_immutable

The domain_id_immutable option will be deprecated in a future
release. Since the version 3.2, Oslo.config supports the
deprecation reason with the attribute "deprecated_reason".
But the domain_id_immutable doesn't have that attribute.

This commit will add a deprecation reason attribute to the
domain_id_immutable option.

Change-Id: If6e3abd361dc93045a038096770b616c61c221e8
Closes-Bug: #1564961
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecation reason for domain_id_immutable

The domain_id_immutable option will be deprecated in a future
release. Since the version 3.2, Oslo.config supports the
deprecation reason with the attribute "deprecated_reason".
But the domain_id_immutable doesn't have that attribute.

This commit will add a deprecation reason attribute to the
domain_id_immutable option.

Change-Id: If6e3abd361dc93045a038096770b616c61c221e8
Closes-Bug: #1564961

subject: Refactor create_image in prep for import from url
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 00:31:15.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Refactor create_image in prep for import from url

Glance supports tasks for importing from a url. That's awesome.
Add support for parameters to indicate that glance should import the
image from a URL. This is a half-functional patch. It should not break
any existing code, but it will not actually do the import. This is to
keep the existing refactor small and make it easier to reason about
reviewing.

Change-Id: I04d76f02d0a09d811d4e665027ce0e7356802e4f
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor create_image in prep for import from url

Glance supports tasks for importing from a url. That's awesome.
Add support for parameters to indicate that glance should import the
image from a URL. This is a half-functional patch. It should not break
any existing code, but it will not actually do the import. This is to
keep the existing refactor small and make it easier to reason about
reviewing.

Change-Id: I04d76f02d0a09d811d4e665027ce0e7356802e4f

testenvs.

Note that the tests were changed for create_server because the tests

Change-Id: I8c69cf1837566b007e0ee4927c3bb3bef553c84a

commit_message:
Fix use of object notation internally to shade

The object notation is deprecated, so this fixes all of the uses of
object notation inside shade itself. This should pass the future
testenvs.

Note that the tests were changed for create_server because the tests
were actually testing an inappropriate leakage of server objects which
should never happen.

Change-Id: I8c69cf1837566b007e0ee4927c3bb3bef553c84a

subject: Add environment variable flag to disable munch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-30 16:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'message': 'Add environment variable flag to disable munch

Since we intend to remove that interface some day, this will allow
us to run our unit tests with and without the munch compatibility layer
to avoid adding any internal dependency on the behavior. It will also
allow shade consumers to run without it optionally when they have
completed any conversion of their own.

Change-Id: I54d430e28e7a20146f7480c9fa6d1e4b95188cc8
'}]
commit_message:
Add environment variable flag to disable munch

Since we intend to remove that interface some day, this will allow
us to run our unit tests with and without the munch compatibility layer
to avoid adding any internal dependency on the behavior. It will also
allow shade consumers to run without it optionally when they have
completed any conversion of their own.

Change-Id: I54d430e28e7a20146f7480c9fa6d1e4b95188cc8

Instead of only using the request_local_cache when an explicit set

The Context Local cache was being used previously when we were seeing

Change-Id: I4857cfe1e62d54c3c89a0206ffc895c4cf681ce5
Closes-Bug: #1567403

commit_message:
Set the values for the request_local_cache

Instead of only using the request_local_cache when an explicit set
occurs, make sure we always set the value for the request_local_cache
when we have to reach for the proxied backend.

The Context Local cache was being used previously when we were seeing
a mix of cache misses and hits. This change ensures we now always
set the value(s) as expected:

Change-Id: I4857cfe1e62d54c3c89a0206ffc895c4cf681ce5
Closes-Bug: #1567403
(cherry picked from commit 9b9bc7767fad36da1c764add842f85efdc48807b)

commit_message:
Add support for removing volume-type-access

OSC does not support to remove volume type access to project.
This feature will provide support to remove volume type access
from project.

Change-Id: I029a4292da05f028e8937962cb845ec6e00b0279

commit_message:
Remove conditional import

Commit 7f07e9788e84326d145620ae62f45c00b67c009a adds conditional
import of exception module of magnumclient. This is not needed
as the requirements explicitly specifies that we require
python-magnumclient>=2.0.0.

Change-Id: Id86d969927e8fb5ee1b60186990dcbd1ea33f9bb

commit_message:
Use to_dict() instead for cinder resources

After the bug #1479641 fixed and we bumped up requirements
for latest release which provides
to_dict() for resources, this patch removes
_show_resources() method for cinder resources.

subject: Fix documentation example again
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 18:06:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/using-sessions.rst'], 'message': "Fix documentation example again

In d0617885 the example in the Service Discovery section was changed to
include the full URL of the endpoint. On closer inspection, it turns
out that the example is deliberately pointing out that you don't need
the full URL when using endpoint filtering, since the endpoint filter
is supposed to look up the endpoint in the catalog. The reason it
wasn't working out of the box, as pointed out in the bug[1], was that
devstack sets up v2.0 endpoints, so the example path was appending /v3
to a v2.0 endpoint and failing.

This patch reverts the example back to using just a path, but omits the
'/v3' part of the path and uses the admin interface so that it will
work on v2.0. This will work out of the box on devstack and will still
work if the user has set up endpoints with '/v3' in them.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystoneauth/+bug/1519054/comments/2

Change-Id: I11637aaa1939327eb6d1819c1b740a99e0f21e83
"}]
commit_message:
Fix documentation example again

In d0617885 the example in the Service Discovery section was changed to
include the full URL of the endpoint. On closer inspection, it turns
out that the example is deliberately pointing out that you don't need
the full URL when using endpoint filtering, since the endpoint filter
is supposed to look up the endpoint in the catalog. The reason it
wasn't working out of the box, as pointed out in the bug[1], was that
devstack sets up v2.0 endpoints, so the example path was appending /v3
to a v2.0 endpoint and failing.

This patch reverts the example back to using just a path, but omits the
'/v3' part of the path and uses the admin interface so that it will
work on v2.0. This will work out of the box on devstack and will still
work if the user has set up endpoints with '/v3' in them.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystoneauth/+bug/1519054/comments/2

Change-Id: I11637aaa1939327eb6d1819c1b740a99e0f21e83

subject: Make sure use IPv6 sockets for Zaqar in IPv6 environment
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 19:01:14.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/transport/wsgi/driver.py'], 'message': "Make sure use IPv6 sockets for Zaqar in IPv6 environment

In IPv6 management network environment, starting Zaqar server will
run into 'Address family for hostname not support' when use WSGI
simple server. The root cause is python TCPServer implementation
is hard-coded to use IPv4, even in IPv6 environments. Fix stolen
from Ceilometer.

Closes-Bug: #1569133

Change-Id: I708bf40526c1ff1632c0034e5758c6725a517ca1
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure use IPv6 sockets for Zaqar in IPv6 environment

In IPv6 management network environment, starting Zaqar server will
run into 'Address family for hostname not support' when use WSGI
simple server. The root cause is python TCPServer implementation
is hard-coded to use IPv4, even in IPv6 environments. Fix stolen
from Ceilometer.

Closes-Bug: #1569133

Change-Id: I708bf40526c1ff1632c0034e5758c6725a517ca1

subject: Fix auth issue when accessing root path "/"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 19:02:19.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/transport/auth.py'], 'message': 'Fix auth issue when accessing root path "/"

Now when access the root path of Zaqar service, for example:
curl GET http://127.0.0.1:8888/, user will see 401 error. Which
will cause some front end proxy(like HAProxy) complain. This
patch fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1569474

Change-Id: I92c98495bf26277cd4c8c1d019c54698cace4bbd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth issue when accessing root path "/"

Now when access the root path of Zaqar service, for example:
curl GET http://127.0.0.1:8888/, user will see 401 error. Which
will cause some front end proxy(like HAProxy) complain. This
patch fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1569474

Change-Id: I92c98495bf26277cd4c8c1d019c54698cace4bbd

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-16 09:59:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/common/io/test_subunit_v2.py', 'rally/common/io/subunit_v2.py'], 'message': '[Verify] Fixing 'xfail' mechanism and whole test case failure issue

If Tempest fails in a test's setUpClass(), the result that will be reported
by Rally is "fail", even though the test is listed in a file passed to
--xfails-file. So this commit fixes the issue.

Also, this commit adds missing unittest for the subunit parser when we have
a file with expected failures.

Closes-Bug: #1568133

Change-Id: I9e10891f02387b45a507a02326ecf81f0cb97bf3
'}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing 'xfail' mechanism and whole test case failure issue

If Tempest fails in a test's setUpClass(), the result that will be reported
by Rally is "fail", even though the test is listed in a file passed to
--xfails-file. So this commit fixes the issue.

Also, this commit adds missing unittest for the subunit parser when we have
a file with expected failures.

Closes-Bug: #1568133

Change-Id: I9e10891f02387b45a507a02326ecf81f0cb97bf3

commit_message:
Add support for setting volume-type-access

OSC does not support to set volume type access to project.
This patch will provide support for adding volume type access
to existing project.

Closes-Bug:#1554889

Implements: bp cinder-command-support

Change-Id: Ie36e202bdde7de36eb263a476eb66699d82f7565

commit_message:
Fix sourcing of config/provider.*

Source the provider config file only in the provider-specific library.
It makes more sense and also fixes a bug that prevented repeat-test
to work properly with repeated tests on KVM.

Change-Id: I0658aba5fe9b08a1ce01f26d4f909f80c621f54c

subject: Honor floating_ip_source: nova everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-16 15:34:25.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Honor floating_ip_source: nova everywhere

We already added support for honoring the floating_ip_source flag, but
we did not add it everywhere. This led to a situation where neutron
would do the port attach and then nova would try to attach the IP.
Whoops.

Change-Id: I19adbd54e828753d9e1d5c810bc7f8ed7294c084
'}]
commit_message:
Honor floating_ip_source: nova everywhere

We already added support for honoring the floating_ip_source flag, but
we did not add it everywhere. This led to a situation where neutron
would do the port attach and then nova would try to attach the IP.
Whoops.

commit_message:
Remove two deprecated config option names from [agent] section

Remove two deprecated options from the config group section [agent]
that were deprecated in the Liberty cycle. Those options are:

- agent_erase_devices_priority
- agent_erase_devices_iterations

These options had been renamed and deprecated by commit
9a35ca19b4872af2e02cb83b21a3746732802e74

Change-Id: I9c6df0979c2814b5f26f8fb596de6cf07e4f76aa

subject: Policy files distribution
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-01-15 08:35:15.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-horizon-install.yml', 'playbooks/policy_files_distribution.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_horizon/templates/horizon_local_settings.py.j2', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml'], 'message': 'Policy files distribution

This change is composed of 2 parts.

1) The horizon role changes
2) The openstack-ansible "glue" changes.

For the horizon role changes, these changes could work even
when the role will be splitted in its independant repository.
The changes makes possible for a deployer to define the
component(s) having a non-standard policy file. The deployer
only have to flip the switch for the component and push its
appropriate policy file into the horizon policy folder.
The result would be to have an horizon UI appropriately
filtered.

For the "glue" changes, they make sure the policy files
are fetched from the deployed components and upload them in the
horizon policy folder.

Change-Id: I212faa25e93b0cf40838c6803dbc9b48f6c5474a
'}]
commit_message:
Policy files distribution

This change is composed of 2 parts.

1) The horizon role changes
2) The openstack-ansible "glue" changes.

For the horizon role changes, these changes could work even
when the role will be splitted in its independant repository.
The changes makes possible for a deployer to define the
component(s) having a non-standard policy file. The deployer
only have to flip the switch for the component and push its
appropriate policy file into the horizon policy folder.
The result would be to have an horizon UI appropriately
filtered.

For the "glue" changes, they make sure the policy files
are fetched from the deployed components and upload them in the
horizon policy folder.

Change-Id: I212faa25e93b0cf40838c6803dbc9b48f6c5474a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-13 15:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Add support for Cisco drivers in Ironic devstack

Ironic devstack currently only supports real hardware being controlled
with the *_ipmitool drivers, this patch adds support for the two Cisco
Ironic drivers UCS and CIMC. To provide this support it deprecates the
old IRONIC_IPMIINFO_FILE replacing it with IRONIC_HWINFO_FILE, which
can support extra fields on top of the standard address, mac address,
username and password fields.

Change-Id: Ia658835491bc8c142c1ddee58df7c4ff7fd5a352
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Cisco drivers in Ironic devstack

Ironic devstack currently only supports real hardware being controlled
with the *_ipmitool drivers, this patch adds support for the two Cisco
Ironic drivers UCS and CIMC. To provide this support it deprecates the
old IRONIC_IPMIINFO_FILE replacing it with IRONIC_HWINFO_FILE, which
can support extra fields on top of the standard address, mac address,
username and password fields.

Change-Id: Ia658835491bc8c142c1ddee58df7c4ff7fd5a352

commit_message:
ovsfw: Load vlan tag from other_config

OVS agent stores vlan tag only to other_config before
setup_port_filter() is called [1], leaving 'tag' column empty. This
patch loads tag from correct place and modifies functional tests
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: 1566934
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/1efed3a5321a259d27ec4a6e80352d35fc423c11/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py#L821

Change-Id: Iaae46ce7362fedfc53af958600d6d712eb382e9f

subject: PG test-helper create matching db for test user
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-28 00:28:39.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/helpers/postgresql_helper.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/helpers/sql_helper.py'], 'message': "PG test-helper create matching db for test user

Postgres scenario tests currently skip data operations because
the test helper fails to connect to the database.

There must be a database with the same name as the user in order
for the user to be able to login.
Once logged in the schema has to be referenced as 'public'.

Scenario tests run, with this fix applied.

* Also changed the dynamic configuration test property - the previous
  value was only in v9.4 and higher.

Change-Id: I4ba124196ff17c245b11fd13dd6bac9d2407c934
"}]
commit_message:
PG test-helper create matching db for test user

Postgres scenario tests currently skip data operations because
the test helper fails to connect to the database.

There must be a database with the same name as the user in order
for the user to be able to login.
Once logged in the schema has to be referenced as 'public'.

Scenario tests run, with this fix applied.

* Also changed the dynamic configuration test property - the previous
  value was only in v9.4 and higher.

Change-Id: I4ba124196ff17c245b11fd13dd6bac9d2407c934

commit_message:
VMware: Support for non-default port

Currently the VMDK driver fails to connect to vCenter server
if vCenter is configured to listen to any port other than the
default port 443. This patch fixes it by adding support for a
new config option 'vmware_host_port' which specifies the port
number to connect to vCenter server.

DocImpact
  Added config option 'vmware_host_port' which specifies the
  port number to connect to vCenter server.

Change-Id: I71846cdc09bc1ff2a7e35d45aa7c639c468f1418
Co-Authored-By: Johnson koil raj <johnson.raj@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1387074

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 8726, 'name': 'Victor Morales', 'email': 'chipahuac@hotmail.com', 'username': 'electrocucaracha'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 06:50:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fixture.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fixture.py'], 'message': 'Introduce fixture to enforce sorted order for object changes

In unit tests, sometimes you want to compare that JSON representation of
an object is identical to a JSON blob. Sadly, it may not work for
objects with changes made, since those changes are represented in the
object as a set, and hence end up in unstable order in JSON blobs.

To facilitate smooth object representation comparison for objects using
__eq__, this fixture enforces sorting for object changes.

Note: this code is directly ripped from Nova tree, with tiny
modifications:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/fixtures.py?id=dd36b6474ee9d70636fd4bc5f30237de2151fc45#n571
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py?id=dd36b6474ee9d70636fd4bc5f30237de2151fc45#n425

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib24eea4af863078d39f8969a7890b5d9d2e11405
Closes-Bug: #1552676
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce fixture to enforce sorted order for object changes

In unit tests, sometimes you want to compare that JSON representation of
an object is identical to a JSON blob. Sadly, it may not work for
objects with changes made, since those changes are represented in the
object as a set, and hence end up in unstable order in JSON blobs.

To facilitate smooth object representation comparison for objects using
__eq__, this fixture enforces sorting for object changes.

Note: this code is directly ripped from Nova tree, with tiny
modifications:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/fixtures.py?id=dd36b6474ee9d70636fd4bc5f30237de2151fc45#n571
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py?id=dd36b6474ee9d70636fd4bc5f30237de2151fc45#n425

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib24eea4af863078d39f8969a7890b5d9d2e11405
Closes-Bug: #1552676

commit_message:
Add instance/instance_uuid to build_requests table

New fields keep needing to be added to build_requests in order to
capture all of the relevant instance information necessary. At this
point it's simpler to just embed a serialized Instance object in the db.
A column for that is added, as well as an instance_uuid column for
indexed lookups.

Change-Id: I1628ddd8cb75b4d0a7bbcd2720536c2e0bfc6043
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj

commit_message:
Script from mistral repo is used in gate-mistral-docker-buildimage job

So in future, if mistral need to change code for this job,
it can be change directly in mistral repo. It will remove
dependency on project-config.
gate-mistral-docker-buildimage job is added to experimental
also.

commit_message:
Remove the job for networking-ofagent master branch

We ryu team plans to remove networking-ofagent sub-project in the Newton
and we maintain only a stable branch till EOL of them.
So the job for networking-ofagent master branch should be removed.

subject: Add experimental ubuntu-xenial jobs for OpenStack-Ansible roles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 17:52:19.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add experimental ubuntu-xenial jobs for OpenStack-Ansible roles

This patch adds experimental Ubuntu Xenial jobs to all the
OpenStack-Ansible roles. The jobs are '-nv' jobs so that if
the 'ansible-role-functional-jobs-xenial' is switched from
the experimental queue to the check/gate queue then these jobs
are not affected. It keeps things more flexible.

Change-Id: I23a5dafed406436ecf4299ae269c6eabe2fa07a5
"}]
commit_message:
Add experimental ubuntu-xenial jobs for OpenStack-Ansible roles

This patch adds experimental Ubuntu Xenial jobs to all the
OpenStack-Ansible roles. The jobs are '-nv' jobs so that if
the 'ansible-role-functional-jobs-xenial' is switched from
the experimental queue to the check/gate queue then these jobs
are not affected. It keeps things more flexible.

Change-Id: I23a5dafed406436ecf4299ae269c6eabe2fa07a5

In this patch we create HA router resources i.e
HA network, HA network ports and vr_id before
1) router creation
2) router updated to HA router
so that these resources are available when agent's rpc worker tries
to sync HA router.

Closes-bug: #1566194
Related-bug: #1499647
Change-Id: Ia017ca626ac4d9a818b65ee7f29930594af4f251
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure HA router resources exists before router creation

In this patch we create HA router resources i.e
HA network, HA network ports and vr_id before
1) router creation
2) router updated to HA router
so that these resources are available when agent's rpc worker tries
to sync HA router.

Closes-bug: #1566194
Related-bug: #1499647
Change-Id: Ia017ca626ac4d9a818b65ee7f29930594af4f251

commit_message:
Deprecate usage of verbose parameter

Since 'oslo_log/verbose' parameter is deprecated and has no effect,
it should not be set via puppet.

Change-Id: I2251d78ff15cc0265c15a3bf736b45993fd7e761
Related-Bug: #1562935

subject: puppet: add xenial jobs in experimental pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 17:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'puppet: add xenial jobs in experimental pipeline

Add Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs running on Xenial in Experimental
pipeline, using Puppet 3 (official version in Xenial until now [1]).

It will help us to move forward with the new Ubuntu LTS and validates
Puppet OpenStack modules can be deployed on this version.

[1] https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/xenial/+source/puppet provides 3.8.5

Change-Id: I5ab85c550543cde062cab0af077a00eef678d7bf
'}]
commit_message:
puppet: add xenial jobs in experimental pipeline

Add Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs running on Xenial in Experimental
pipeline, using Puppet 3 (official version in Xenial until now [1]).

It will help us to move forward with the new Ubuntu LTS and validates
Puppet OpenStack modules can be deployed on this version.

[1] https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/xenial/+source/puppet provides 3.8.5

Change-Id: I5ab85c550543cde062cab0af077a00eef678d7bf

commit_message:
Fix configuration string for haproxy

Use user and group configuration option, uid and gid need a number
instead of a name. Specifying a name for uid/gid attributes will make
haproxy run under the root user.

Change-Id: I1d6db661b7d0958e1ba888770e3ce789d7cb4a76
(cherry picked from commit a2c1d8ca2cc2d67e91f269c712781ae93d6903b0)

commit_message:
Revert the legacy_compute v2 api for nova

The related bugs are closed long-long time ago,

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 17:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['cue/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_wsme_objects.py', 'cue/api/middleware/parsable_error.py', 'cue/templates/install_rabbit.sh.tmpl', 'cue/taskflow/retry/exception_times.py', 'cue/tests/functional/fixtures/neutron.py', 'cue/tests/functional/taskflow/flow/test_create_cluster.py', 'os_tasklib/common/reduce_task.py', 'cue/monitor/monitor_service.py', 'cue/tests/unit/cmd/test_monitor.py', 'cue/tests/functional/fixtures/nova.py', 'cue/tests/functional/fixtures/urllib2_fixture.py'], 'message': 'Finish the Python 3 port

with this change, all unit and functional tests pass on Python 3.4.

* WSGI middleware: on Python 3, decode the error message from UTF-8.
* Replace json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() of
  oslo_serialization to get bytes on Python 3.
* monitor_service.py, test_monitor.py: Fix usage of tooz, pass byte
  strings to the coordinator API.
* Fix nova and neutron fixtures: replace dict.values() with
  list(dict.values()) to get list on Python 3.
* Fix urllib2_fixture: On Python 3, replace urllib2 with
  urllib.request.
* test_create_cluster.py: don't sort exception types, but use a set
  instead to compare them. On Python 3, comparison between exception
  types now raises a TypeError.
* test_wsme_objects.py: catch also TypeError on wsme validation. On
  Python 3, comparison between the new attribute value and the
  minimum raises a TypeError which is not wrapped into a
  InvalidInput exception of wsme. See also the change
  I74103330ccb5cdc26aa3508fcefcc34310e00c27 which proposes to wrap
  TypeError.
* install_rabbit.sh.tmpl: replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items().
* Replace generator.next() with next(generator).
* Replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce()
* Replace "str is 'URLError'" test with "str == 'URLError'", using is
  to compare strings is not reliable.

Change-Id: I45e23b71218f5ff936b0fd1bd628f29210f984bb
'}]
commit_message:
Finish the Python 3 port

with this change, all unit and functional tests pass on Python 3.4.

* WSGI middleware: on Python 3, decode the error message from UTF-8.
* Replace json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() of
  oslo_serialization to get bytes on Python 3.
* monitor_service.py, test_monitor.py: Fix usage of tooz, pass byte
  strings to the coordinator API.
* Fix nova and neutron fixtures: replace dict.values() with
  list(dict.values()) to get list on Python 3.
* Fix urllib2_fixture: On Python 3, replace urllib2 with
  urllib.request.
* test_create_cluster.py: don't sort exception types, but use a set
  instead to compare them. On Python 3, comparison between exception
  types now raises a TypeError.
* test_wsme_objects.py: catch also TypeError on wsme validation. On
  Python 3, comparison between the new attribute value and the
  minimum raises a TypeError which is not wrapped into a
  InvalidInput exception of wsme. See also the change
  I74103330ccb5cdc26aa3508fcefcc34310e00c27 which proposes to wrap
  TypeError.
* install_rabbit.sh.tmpl: replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items().
* Replace generator.next() with next(generator).
* Replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce()
* Replace "str is 'URLError'" test with "str == 'URLError'", using is
  to compare strings is not reliable.

Change-Id: I45e23b71218f5ff936b0fd1bd628f29210f984bb

commit_message:
network: make nova to handle port_security_enabled=False

In somes cases we need to have network without any security rules
applied, unfortunatly nova does not provide way to remove l3
assignements and always at least expose the default security group.
This commit updates code to clear security groups applied to the
network when option port_security_enabled=False is activated on the
network.

Change-Id: I630008a9733624a9d9b59b7aa3b8b2a3f8985d61
Closes-Bug: #1460630
Related-Bug: #1175464

commit_message:
Devref: Newton updates for transition to OSC

Update the "Transition to OpenStack Client" devref with the plan
for handling network resources in Newton. In particular, this
update clarifies the OpenStack project where the commands will
reside. This update attempts to capture some of the information
in [1] and to address packaging concerns.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/osc-neutron-support

Change-Id: I95e579ab23377a6cf36fc7a50356ab406d350053
Related-Bug: #1521291

commit_message:
Update help information for lbaasv2 CLIs

Help information for lbaasV2 Update CLIs lack several options
( Refer bug#1515111 ). This patch adds all the options  which
are missing in the  "neutron lbaas-*-update " CLIs
Also updated is the --http-method for HealthMonitor,
making it case in-sensitive.
This also adds update of --default-pool for L7 support.

Change-Id: If859dc899efa92173c7a654e3f1481b35790faaa
Closes-Bug: #1515111
Closes-Bug: #1523968

The Dell SC driver was not using provider_id. For volumes it now
stores the Dell SC instanceId in provider_id. For snapshots it stores
the volume's instanceId in the snapshot's provider_id. Snapshots are
still located by description.

Change-Id: I6e365ce401b72601475c781fe884671d81097d77
"}]
commit_message:
Dell SC: Updated to utilize provider_id

The Dell SC driver was not using provider_id. For volumes it now
stores the Dell SC instanceId in provider_id. For snapshots it stores
the volume's instanceId in the snapshot's provider_id. Snapshots are
still located by description.

Cleaned up some code. Removed the excessive find_sc calls. Updated
error messages.

Updated tests to use fake uuids.

Change-Id: I6e365ce401b72601475c781fe884671d81097d77

commit_message:
Use delete_index instead of alias_listener_update

alias_listener_update removes an index from an alias then deletes the
index, which could be instead by just deleting the index.

Change-Id: Ib616c0b46348e282906bb77a75829377d8401561
Closes-bug: #1563074

commit_message:
Set oslo options in keystone module through puppet-oslo

Key moments:
  * use oslo::{db,log,cache,policy},
    oslo::messaging::{default,notifications,rabbit}
  * update top-file docs
  * add new parameters provided by oslo
  * update tests accordingly
  * add oslo dependency to "metadata.json"
  * add release notes

Change-Id: I6840b7b9a0cd4832794b1b2a017fc241759aab66

subject: Do not check for rabbit user before installed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 21:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbitmq_context.py', 'hooks/rabbitmq_context.py'], 'message': 'Do not check for rabbit user before installed

The charm was trying to lookup the rabbit user before rabbitmq-server
was installed. Check for installation state before doing so.

Change-Id: I25eb8e26d3e01b13e13205a41e4f1f2e924d96f7
Closes-Bug: #1570970
'}]
commit_message:
Do not check for rabbit user before installed

The charm was trying to lookup the rabbit user before rabbitmq-server
was installed. Check for installation state before doing so.

Change-Id: I25eb8e26d3e01b13e13205a41e4f1f2e924d96f7
Closes-Bug: #1570970

commit_message:
BGP Dynamic Routing: neutronclient changes

This patch adds neutronclient support for BGP routing functionality.

Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <rktidwell85@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5b20bcbf6c837495d81c395f600498d2c8f3495c

subject: Ensure apache2 ready when keystone is disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 13:49:17.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/keystone_hooks.py'], 'message': 'Ensure apache2 ready when keystone is disabled

If the charm moves from a state where keystone is running as a
standalone service to one where it is running from within apache then
as soon as the keystone service is stopped it needs to be accessable
via apache as the charm queries its local keystone. This cannot wait
for a decorator to restart services

Change-Id: I026ef9f6548c38eed9850af1233a03a3d293dd4b
Closes-Bug: 1570579
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure apache2 ready when keystone is disabled

If the charm moves from a state where keystone is running as a
standalone service to one where it is running from within apache then
as soon as the keystone service is stopped it needs to be accessable
via apache as the charm queries its local keystone. This cannot wait
for a decorator to restart services

Change-Id: I026ef9f6548c38eed9850af1233a03a3d293dd4b
Closes-Bug: 1570579

Create identity-tenant relation

This relation can be used by any charm that requires service level
authentication but does not wish to register a service catalog entry.

subject: Send credentials for tenant only service relation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 18:53:38.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/keystone_utils.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Send credentials for tenant only service relation

When *_urls are set to "None" as is done with openstack dashboard and
service is set on the identity-relation, create and pass back
credentials on the relation.

This will be used for any charm that requires service level
authentication but does not wish to register a catalog serivce entry.

Change-Id: I37b91263a5107c8cc5e40522cd6530bcbd7a7a81
'}]
commit_message:
Send credentials for tenant only service relation

When *_urls are set to "None" as is done with openstack dashboard and
service is set on the identity-relation, create and pass back
credentials on the relation.

This will be used for any charm that requires service level
authentication but does not wish to register a catalog serivce entry.

Change-Id: I37b91263a5107c8cc5e40522cd6530bcbd7a7a81

commit_message:
pin google-api-client to 0.9.4

google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0, so we need to pin to
0.9.4.

See https://github.com/google/google-api-ruby-client/issues/397

Change-Id: I8a6e5e56c1e6d36e66febd878507f8eef5c5a738
Closes-Bug: #1570627
(cherry picked from commit a301dd0439459457278041716e6ff700dd8d83b0)

commit_message:
Adds eventlet monkey patching of select module if thread is pathed

Oslo.messaging pika driver requires patching of select module if thread
is patched.
Pika driver uses select call and if it is not patched onsuming messages
blocks whole eventlet loop

Closes-Bug: #1570242
Change-Id: I9756737309f401ebddb7475eb84725f65bca01bf

commit_message:
Stop managing rabbit resources

We stopped to manage rabbit resources from openstack puppet
modules a long time ago, but cinder module still contains
rabbit class for its managing. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: Ie506e54b3d4ac53357af1819cb6df1be428b98f3

Previously, attempting to PUT a SLO manifest with `If-None-Match: *`
would include the header when validating the segments, causing the
upload to fail.

Now when SLO validates segments, no conditional headers will be
included in the HEAD request.

Change-Id: I03ad454092d3caa73d29e6d30d8033b45bc96136
Closes-Bug: #1569253
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include conditional headers in SLO HEAD requests

Previously, attempting to PUT a SLO manifest with `If-None-Match: *`
would include the header when validating the segments, causing the
upload to fail.

Now when SLO validates segments, no conditional headers will be
included in the HEAD request.

Change-Id: I03ad454092d3caa73d29e6d30d8033b45bc96136
Closes-Bug: #1569253

commit_message:
Add purge_config option for all configs

Adding a purge_config option for all configs (specifically left out
services/lbaas.pp and services/vpnaas.pp as they require default
entries). Adding this option for ease of management and readability.
If users wish, they can use this to ensure that only the options they
are setting make it into the configs.
  *rebased my changes

Change-Id: I2286acb350ae6300f2e4c8dd320f2534ddf09bf9

rabbitmq class for its management. This patch deprecates it.

commit_message:
Create shim so magic-search works after changes

Horizon is making changes to the magic-search feature that due to
various scoping causes immediate problems in Searchlight's use of
magic-search.  This patch simply creates a shim to ensure that we
don't lose functionality in the short term as magic-search gets
fixed.

Change-Id: Ibc98f12ddc7ec611255c8a20ce19e4eabab74caa
Depends-On: I461b233e56ddf404d75c094c54473e43ee50e7c8

* Have resource clients assert the expected status code where the base method
  accepts multiple possible success codes.
* Remove hardcoded zone name from test_no_create_superdomain_by_alt_user

commit_message:
Several test cleanups

* Remove redundant assertions - e.g. checking for CREATE+PENDING in every
  test, rather than just creation tests.
* Make client.get_uri public
* Port test for NotFound when listing domains with a .json extension
* Have resource clients assert the expected status code where the base method
  accepts multiple possible success codes.
* Remove hardcoded zone name from test_no_create_superdomain_by_alt_user
* Have zone update test explicitly update and validate field
* Create zone test shouldn't test fetching a zone

Change-Id: I3f0efe61452186c7399fd6196ff3509872c77a80

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-31 19:42:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/floating_ip.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_floating_ip.py'], 'message': "Give the FloatingIP object an external_id field, because neutron

Neutron floating ips have UUID identifiers, not integer ones like
nova-network. Nova's FloatingIP object doesn't have a place to stash
that in neutronapi so that it can be sent back to the REST API.

This is kinda broken because it means the REST API is returning
strings when neutron is in use, and integers when nova-network is
used. However, that's a different problem, so we add a place to
stash it here.

Needed for blueprint rm-object-dict-compat-newton

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Rossiter <rlrossit@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ic2980333351583b377e4eb29d6140d6e4a00db92
"}]
commit_message:
Give the FloatingIP object an external_id field, because neutron

Neutron floating ips have UUID identifiers, not integer ones like
nova-network. Nova's FloatingIP object doesn't have a place to stash
that in neutronapi so that it can be sent back to the REST API.

This is kinda broken because it means the REST API is returning
strings when neutron is in use, and integers when nova-network is
used. However, that's a different problem, so we add a place to
stash it here.

Needed for blueprint rm-object-dict-compat-newton

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Rossiter <rlrossit@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ic2980333351583b377e4eb29d6140d6e4a00db92

subject: Update source-branch-updater to work with IRR's
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-15 12:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/ansible-role-requirements-editor.py', 'scripts/sources-branch-updater.sh'], 'message': "Update source-branch-updater to work with IRR's

This updated the sources-branch-updater convenience script which
is used to update SHA's and ensure that all carried files are
appropriately included in the update.

The patch includes the following changes:

 - Automatically submit updates of applicable files to all the
   independent repositories.

 - Automatically update the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   with the latest SHA from the independent repositories or the
   latest tag from any repositories that are not part of OSA.
   This functionality is disabled by design for the master branch.

 - Adds ansible-role-requirements-editor.py which provides the
   ability to edit the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   appropriately and output a consistent result.

Conflicts:
 - ansible-role-requirements.yml

Backport note:
 - This patch also includes the subsequent update of the script
   from Idde0141691e1008bead802bd6f3759c12e37b02b

Change-Id: I67fadeb43cc65a557d0380a12eb3e94335097d0d
(cherry picked from commit fac50305715d23b07626cf0ce551b531128ac34e)
"}]
commit_message:
Update source-branch-updater to work with IRR's

This updated the sources-branch-updater convenience script which
is used to update SHA's and ensure that all carried files are
appropriately included in the update.

The patch includes the following changes:

 - Automatically submit updates of applicable files to all the
   independent repositories.

 - Automatically update the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   with the latest SHA from the independent repositories or the
   latest tag from any repositories that are not part of OSA.
   This functionality is disabled by design for the master branch.

 - Adds ansible-role-requirements-editor.py which provides the
   ability to edit the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   appropriately and output a consistent result.

Conflicts:
 - ansible-role-requirements.yml

Backport note:
 - This patch also includes the subsequent update of the script
   from Idde0141691e1008bead802bd6f3759c12e37b02b

Change-Id: I67fadeb43cc65a557d0380a12eb3e94335097d0d
(cherry picked from commit fac50305715d23b07626cf0ce551b531128ac34e)

by which resource types (images, instances, etc.) register their actions

subject: Enable Mitaka amulet tests
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-15 16:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['Makefile', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'tests/019-basic-trusty-mitaka', 'tests/016-basic-trusty-juno', 'tests/021-basic-xenial-mitaka'], 'message': 'Enable Mitaka amulet tests

Disable Juno tests (no longer supported).

Switch Xenial tests to use BE release of ODL, as the default
Helium release is not compatible with Java 8 (which is the
default in 16.04).

Update ovs bridge controller checks to validate against
legacy 6633 and IANA assigned 6653 ports; only check br-int
configuration for later ODL releases.

Drop wider service checks from amulet test.

Re-align with Neutron security group management.

Change-Id: Ic1e92b292c0276232a29695d02096ba1e3275236
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Mitaka amulet tests

Disable Juno tests (no longer supported).

Switch Xenial tests to use BE release of ODL, as the default
Helium release is not compatible with Java 8 (which is the
default in 16.04).

Update ovs bridge controller checks to validate against
legacy 6633 and IANA assigned 6653 ports; only check br-int
configuration for later ODL releases.

Drop wider service checks from amulet test.

Re-align with Neutron security group management.

Change-Id: Ic1e92b292c0276232a29695d02096ba1e3275236

commit_message:
Don't require a Content-Length for 204 responses

A 204 response has no content by definition so there is no need
to require a Content-Length header.

Change-Id: I74c074986ec0bc9f44ba5baf48b0207cd77ebd5f

subject: Rabbitmq Upgrade restarts container only when image was changed.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 18:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/rabbitmq/tasks/upgrade.yml'], 'message': "Rabbitmq Upgrade restarts container only when image was changed.

This fix adds a check of Rabbitmq's image version during the upgrade.
The container gets restarted only when the image version is different.

Change-Id: Ie038845c0c8fff1ac51b7cbf21e1b593229c2c0e

commit_message:
Rabbitmq Upgrade restarts container only when image was changed.

This fix adds a check of Rabbitmq's image version during the upgrade.
The container gets restarted only when the image version is different.

Change-Id: Ie038845c0c8fff1ac51b7cbf21e1b593229c2c0e
Closes-Bug: #1558832
(cherry picked from commit d73ee4a856b84b5d19d7b604f49ce5cbb8d061d4)

subject: run-wheel.sh: only run wheel for Python projects
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 16:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-wheel.sh'], 'message': "run-wheel.sh: only run wheel for Python projects

tarball JJB macro run wheel, but we have to verify if the project is
whether or not a Python project.

This patch will make possible for Puppet modules to run the tarball
macro without complexity.
We check if it's a Python project if metadata.json file IS NOT present.
Indeed, this file is really Puppet specific.

Change-Id: Id2e307ae53b8ef1bb2be71c8ba3541cadb5ca12b
"}]
commit_message:
run-wheel.sh: only run wheel for Python projects

tarball JJB macro run wheel, but we have to verify if the project is
whether or not a Python project.

This patch will make possible for Puppet modules to run the tarball
macro without complexity.
We check if it's a Python project if metadata.json file IS NOT present.
Indeed, this file is really Puppet specific.

Change-Id: Id2e307ae53b8ef1bb2be71c8ba3541cadb5ca12b

commit_message:
add new portal_port option for iscsi module

IPA supported iSCSI portal port customization by 272420 patch.

With this patch, we add new portal_port argument into
agent_client.start_iscsi_target() method to pass iSCSI portal
port to IPA side. And add new configuration into iscsi module as
below:

CONF.iscsi.portal_port

Reference:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/272420/

Change-Id: Ia1515cbd6723a965e362a7dfa0b58077194401f3
Closes-Bug: #1523829

subject: Fixing keepalived bug when 2+ backup nodes have the same priority
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/vars/configs/keepalived_haproxy.yml', 'doc/source/install-guide/configure-haproxy.rst', 'playbooks/haproxy-install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/keepalived-upgrade-e63a11b7d4dcba20.yaml'], 'message': "Fixing keepalived bug when 2+ backup nodes have the same priority

The issue is present if you're running 2 or more nodes with
a keepalived < 1.2.8. This bumps the version of keepalived role
(installing a more recent version of keepalived by default) AND
edits the keepalived configuration file to avoid having nodes
with the same priority.

This will restart your keepalived service.

Please note this commit is not meant for backporting. The deployer
running on mitaka and below should follow the documentation here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279664/

Bug: #1545066

Change-Id: Ie28d2d3fa8670212c64ecbdf5a87314e7ca0a2d9
(cherry picked from commit 12a3fbafd03ff7272125a7b71e4538dadd252699)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing keepalived bug when 2+ backup nodes have the same priority

The issue is present if you're running 2 or more nodes with
a keepalived < 1.2.8. This bumps the version of keepalived role
(installing a more recent version of keepalived by default) AND
edits the keepalived configuration file to avoid having nodes
with the same priority.

This will restart your keepalived service.

Please note this commit is not meant for backporting. The deployer
running on mitaka and below should follow the documentation here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279664/

Bug: #1545066

Change-Id: Ie28d2d3fa8670212c64ecbdf5a87314e7ca0a2d9
(cherry picked from commit 12a3fbafd03ff7272125a7b71e4538dadd252699)

subject: Add TLS to Kibana Web Interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 18:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2'], 'message': 'Add TLS to Kibana Web Interface

Use HAProxy to terminate a TLS connection on port 5601 for the
Kibana dashboard when TLS is enabled for Kolla. x-forwarded-for
and x-forwarded-proto headers are set to give Kibana the info it
needs to write returned URLs.

Change-Id: I03a2dd3a8e2513d38281b30bf4bae6449fec0316
Closes-bug: #1566117
'}]
commit_message:
Add TLS to Kibana Web Interface

Use HAProxy to terminate a TLS connection on port 5601 for the
Kibana dashboard when TLS is enabled for Kolla. x-forwarded-for
and x-forwarded-proto headers are set to give Kibana the info it
needs to write returned URLs.

Change-Id: I03a2dd3a8e2513d38281b30bf4bae6449fec0316
Closes-bug: #1566117

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-15 16:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/_static/api-site.css'], 'message': "Collection of CSS fixes

This ensures all parameter tables are 100% wide, even if they have
only a few items with short descriptions. It makes all the tables the
same width.

This moves the link icon into the gutter for the main content, and
makes it hidden by default (only visible on hover) like in the API
site today.

This makes the link + method name div be ``white-space: nowrap`` to
ensure that when the screen gets narrower the Delete button doesn't
fold up on itself.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I3892e6c8e3c01956d63a33603ba1bf9146d21161
"}]
commit_message:
Collection of CSS fixes

This ensures all parameter tables are 100% wide, even if they have
only a few items with short descriptions. It makes all the tables the
same width.

This moves the link icon into the gutter for the main content, and
makes it hidden by default (only visible on hover) like in the API
site today.

This makes the link + method name div be ``white-space: nowrap`` to
ensure that when the screen gets narrower the Delete button doesn't
fold up on itself.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I3892e6c8e3c01956d63a33603ba1bf9146d21161

subject: Convert devstack docs jobs to regular format
revisions:

Devstack used to be using "shocco" to build HTML pages of scripts,
which I think was the reason these jobs were not using the existing
framework.  That is removed with
Ie7f4b265368f1d10a8908d75e11d625b2cc39e7c so I think we can remove any

Change-Id: I3a4128f6ee24b295e86d9e13af1e6d0a4d429269

commit_message:
Convert devstack docs jobs to regular format

Devstack used to be using "shocco" to build HTML pages of scripts,
which I think was the reason these jobs were not using the existing
framework.  That is removed with
Ie7f4b265368f1d10a8908d75e11d625b2cc39e7c so I think we can remove any
devstack-specific documentation jobs.

Change-Id: I3a4128f6ee24b295e86d9e13af1e6d0a4d429269

commit_message:
Add TLS to Kibana Web Interface

Use HAProxy to terminate a TLS connection on port 5601 for the
Kibana dashboard when TLS is enabled for Kolla. x-forwarded-for
and x-forwarded-proto headers are set to give Kibana the info it
needs to write returned URLs.

Change-Id: I03a2dd3a8e2513d38281b30bf4bae6449fec0316
Closes-bug: #1566117

subject: Fix missing 'qos' in extension drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 12:51:17.000000000', 'files': ['templates/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.j2'], 'message': 'Fix missing 'qos' in extension drivers

When qos plugin is defined in 'neutron_plugin_base' it should
also be added to 'extension_drivers' at ml2_conf.ini. If not,
neutron-server will not start, throwing the following error:
"ExtensionDriverNotFound: Extension driver qos required for
service plugin qos not found."

Change-Id: I87839e8c0fb0db27b89538d10d0573e80235260a
(cherry picked from commit 239f58dd40515f0c6355fbbfbb26a90ca2c25322)

commit_message:
Fix missing 'qos' in extension drivers

When qos plugin is defined in 'neutron_plugin_base' it should
also be added to 'extension_drivers' at ml2_conf.ini. If not,
neutron-server will not start, throwing the following error:
"ExtensionDriverNotFound: Extension driver qos required for
service plugin qos not found."

Change-Id: I87839e8c0fb0db27b89538d10d0573e80235260a
(cherry picked from commit 239f58dd40515f0c6355fbbfbb26a90ca2c25322)

it can use mock to do the test without config option,

Change-Id: If38148e178e50a348810312826b16cbd34ba550b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove stub_compute config options

console use stub_compute to perform easy unit test,
it can use mock to do the test without config option,
so remove it and it's safe because it's only related
to test purpose and no side effect to end user.

Change-Id: If38148e178e50a348810312826b16cbd34ba550b

subject: Deprecate managing of rabbitmq resources
revisions:
