commit_message:
Deprecate managing of rabbitmq resources

We stopped to manage rabbitmq resources from openstack puppet
modules a long time ago, but manila module still contains
rabbitmq class for its managing. This patch deprecates it.

Change-Id: Ica717e76374359f8eb3a4e2f0c06fff48fd05b2d

subject: Enable TLS/SSL for Kibana
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 09:07:26.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/kibana/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/kibana/templates/kibana.json.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/kibana/templates/kibana.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Enable TLS/SSL for Kibana

This uses a proxy bridge to enable Kibana TLS/SSL encryption.  In
this model the initial connection to HaProxy is secured via TLS
for password authentication, so password authenticatoin is not done
over freetext.  After that, HaProxy decrypts the data from the backend
service and re-encrypts it using the TLS connection setup on the
frontend.

Change-Id: I6ab57673436dd11f88dc2958da65cfcc83328569
Closes-Bug: #1566117
'}]
commit_message:
Enable TLS/SSL for Kibana

This uses a proxy bridge to enable Kibana TLS/SSL encryption.  In
this model the initial connection to HaProxy is secured via TLS
for password authentication, so password authenticatoin is not done
over freetext.  After that, HaProxy decrypts the data from the backend
service and re-encrypts it using the TLS connection setup on the
frontend.

Change-Id: I6ab57673436dd11f88dc2958da65cfcc83328569
Closes-Bug: #1566117

subject: Stop uploading to job logs to swift
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 17:20:36.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/openstack-publish-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/windmill.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/xstatic.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/searchlight.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/anvil-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/grenade.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack.yaml'], 'message': 'Stop uploading to job logs to swift

We have some headroom on the logs filesystem and this allows us to go
back to more reliable methods of grabbing logs. Specifically we are not
required to have http access back to the jenkins master from every job
that runs into order to get the console logs then upload them to swift.

Change-Id: Ie8479c224b2fd3c3efca4e1bf4157656540eccff
'}]
commit_message:
Stop uploading to job logs to swift

We have some headroom on the logs filesystem and this allows us to go
back to more reliable methods of grabbing logs. Specifically we are not
required to have http access back to the jenkins master from every job
that runs into order to get the console logs then upload them to swift.

Change-Id: Ie8479c224b2fd3c3efca4e1bf4157656540eccff

commit_message:
WIP: Try to get service name in logs

When running the cinder-volume service with multiple backends,
it is very difficult to corrolate which log messages are posted
by which backend. This patch is an attempt to inject the service
name into the context so it is available for logging.

Change-Id: I94279dd4224aef72d4babaa73c11775665d62c60

subject: Propose policy-based scheduler for Newton
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-26 00:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/policy-scheduler.rst'], 'message': 'Propose policy-based scheduler for Newton

We propose a policy-aware scheduler that allows the Nova
administrator (as well as Nova tenant administrators) to
control placement decisions by writing policy statements
that dictate which VMs or containers can be placed on which
hosts.  The policy-aware scheduler will plug into the
existing scheduler framework, enabling administrators to
choose the scheduler when Nova is deployed.

Change-Id: Ief07aefb0196a9072177cf8146f61cab3f7d8f55
Blueprint: policy-based-platform-aware-scheduler
'}]
commit_message:
Propose policy-based scheduler for Newton

We propose a policy-aware scheduler that allows the Nova
administrator (as well as Nova tenant administrators) to
control placement decisions by writing policy statements
that dictate which VMs or containers can be placed on which
hosts.  The policy-aware scheduler will plug into the
existing scheduler framework, enabling administrators to
choose the scheduler when Nova is deployed.

Change-Id: Ief07aefb0196a9072177cf8146f61cab3f7d8f55
Blueprint: policy-based-platform-aware-scheduler

subject: ensure mysql defaults file is sourced
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 14:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f
'}]
commit_message:
ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f

The container gets restarted only when the image version is different.

Closes-Bug: #1558832
"}]
commit_message:
Rabbitmq Upgrade restarts container only when image was changed.

This fix adds a check of Rabbitmq's image version during the upgrade.
The container gets restarted only when the image version is different.

Change-Id: Ie038845c0c8fff1ac51b7cbf21e1b593229c2c0e
Closes-Bug: #1558832

commit_message:
Reorganize test playbooks

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group vars required by containers
  - store extra variables in a single shared test-vars file
  - remove use of the openstack_hosts role
  - include callback plugin for human readable logging of test tasks

Change-Id: I4829e368003f58685cb96b7ee743255d00542187

Change-Id: I62e34b1f0f32c19acbeccd11bc2ea38a2b119951
'}]
commit_message:
Use configured overrides for internal/external

Some clouds (hi internap) have very difficult to discover internal and
external networks. They defy all of our other logic, but we have
configuation for this purpose. However, we were lettting discovery
override configuration. Boo on us.

Change-Id: I62e34b1f0f32c19acbeccd11bc2ea38a2b119951

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 15259, 'name': 'Michael Xin', 'email': 'michael.xin@rackspace.com', 'username': 'michaelxin'}, {'_account_id': 15515, 'name': 'Charles Neill', 'email': 'charles.neill@rackspace.com', 'username': 'cneill'}, {'_account_id': 17709, 'name': 'Michael Dong', 'email': 'michael.dong@rackspace.com', 'username': 'mdong'}, {'_account_id': 18462, 'name': 'Rahul U Nair', 'email': 'rahulunair@gmail.com', 'username': 'rahulunair'}, {'_account_id': 18729, 'name': 'Matt Valdes', 'email': 'matthew.valdes@rackspace.com', 'username': 'mvaldes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-15 17:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/tests/fuzz/datagen.py'], 'message': 'ImpactedParameter names now understand identifiers in bracketed strings

If your request template has a bracketed string, such as: GET
/v2.0/users/{userid:xxxxxxxxxxxxx}, The ImpactedParameter will now report the
"name" parameter as "userid" instead of "userid:xxxxxxxxxxxxx". However, if our
request template looks like: GET /v2.0/users/{xxxxxxxxxxxxx}, The "name"
parameter will still be reported as "xxxxxxxxxxxxx".

Change-Id: I4cb95d064338501b7397a494e780546884a531c2
'}]
commit_message:
ImpactedParameter names now understand identifiers in bracketed strings

If your request template has a bracketed string, such as: GET
/v2.0/users/{userid:xxxxxxxxxxxxx}, The ImpactedParameter will now report the
"name" parameter as "userid" instead of "userid:xxxxxxxxxxxxx". However, if our
request template looks like: GET /v2.0/users/{xxxxxxxxxxxxx}, The "name"
parameter will still be reported as "xxxxxxxxxxxxx".

Change-Id: I4cb95d064338501b7397a494e780546884a531c2

commit_message:
networking-midonet: Move coverage job from post to check

This coverage job doesn't seem to take too much longer than
usual py27 job.  So no good reason to have it on post.
On my local environment it was "2895.76s user 150.34s system"
vs "2285.94s user 146.06s system".

Change-Id: I8df628110e051a1b7dfdce774d5549dc68721e25

We are currently using block quotes for license comments, which means
that Sphinx pulls this into every module, which is bad. Hash-prefixed
comments for licenses seem to be the standard for OpenStack as well.

Change-Id: Iabc60228c1201a960f672e1b0c7ab3c5312c9d8e
Implements: blueprint docstring-add-to-framework
"}]
commit_message:
Change license from block quotes to '#'s (Sphinx)

We are currently using block quotes for license comments, which means
that Sphinx pulls this into every module, which is bad. Hash-prefixed
comments for licenses seem to be the standard for OpenStack as well.

Change-Id: Iabc60228c1201a960f672e1b0c7ab3c5312c9d8e
Implements: blueprint docstring-add-to-framework

commit_message:
Use proper CentOS repositories for ceph and qemu

CentOS has a virtualization sig and storage sig which produces
udpated ceph and qemu images.  These images are then reused within
the rest of Red Hat packaging.  Install these repositories for
CentOS and make use of them.

This should work for OracleLinux as well.
Still testing centos.

Co-Authored-By: Vikram Hosakote <vhosakot@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>

Conflicts:
	docker/base/Dockerfile.j2

Change-Id: Iea21fc4f33bbfdb973cf354d492c372bd3360acb
Closes-Bug: #1566588
(cherry picked from commit e37fa65f4fd729014f12559d36becb5853c46fce)

commit_message:
Fix totp test fails randomly

The test_with_multiple_users test would fail if the time happened to
roll over to the next chunk for the totp generator. The fix is to
control the clock in the test to this can't happen.

Change-Id: I2b92a0cc08ba8e36edc87cb76960a46746895458
(cherry picked from commit 3eaea2fdf417a03aeb539cd35ab28f01de5886af)

commit_message:
Fix explicit waiting if instance has error status

This patches includes:
- don't wait instance launching if instance in error status
- add missed assertTrue to validate notification messages
- check that message is present and is displayed

Change-Id: If731751fa4deabdeebe373748b169ac7ac617f8c
Closes-Bug: #1569941

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I9f833ed6c9881803702466775895c1ad63d0d21d
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
move sphinx h3 to '-' instead of '^'

In the sphinx document h3 is supposed to be '-' not '^':

=, for sections
-, for subsections
^, for subsubsections

We have to enforce consistency here because we're processing included
files which all have to agree, otherwise it's a sphinx error.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: Ic6eef5cacb07870f161b04b031e332f2b87aeedc

commit_message:
Return exceptions as JSON

Webob doesn't easily allow non-HTML exceptions. This is inspired
(wholesale) from heat, which wraps exceptions and formats them in
middleware. api-paste.ini is changed to include the middleware.

Change-Id: Ie59df27989b5d2d2dd2dd1b1570f9a586cbfe8fe
Closes-Bug: #1469336

commit_message:
Add a few more layout checks

Create three new checks for zuul/layout.yaml:
* Ensure every project has a check job
* Ensure every project has a gate job
* Ensure that no check or gate pipeline mixes noop jobs with real jobs

vinz-webclient did not have any gate jobs defined, so add noop to its
gate pipeline.

Change-Id: I5935cfbb0e99270af22ca144382b35f6a1b08fee

subject: ensure mysql defaults file is sourced
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 13:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f
(cherry picked from commit b9a7361b28a7acb2dd05ef960cf474dc91486a6a)
'}]
commit_message:
ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f
(cherry picked from commit b9a7361b28a7acb2dd05ef960cf474dc91486a6a)

does not match expectations.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 18:18:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Reload rebuild_instance ComputeManager method

Commit dc0221d7240326a2d1b467e2a367bebb7e764e61 to nova added a new
scheduled_node parameter to rebuild_instance method. If not
specified (as it happens in case of ironic instance rebuild), the
first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
compute node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Depends-On: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
Change-Id: I3b414d6d8d244f9fed0e63342f4e05d24fbea0b8
'}]
commit_message:
Reload rebuild_instance ComputeManager method

Commit dc0221d7240326a2d1b467e2a367bebb7e764e61 to nova added a new
scheduled_node parameter to rebuild_instance method. If not
specified (as it happens in case of ironic instance rebuild), the
first ironic node is selected:

 computes = ComputeNodeList.get_all_by_host(context, host, use_slave)
 return computes[0]

After the first rebuild, instance.node is updated to be this first
compute node, which causes subsequent rebuilds to fail.

Closes-bug: #1564921
Depends-On: I2fe6e439135ba6aa4120735d030ced31081ef202
Change-Id: I3b414d6d8d244f9fed0e63342f4e05d24fbea0b8

commit_message:
Append existing information during port set

Existing --fixed-ip and --binding-profile information is
currently overwritten when a user executes 'port set', but
actually that data should be appended.
This patch fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1564453
Change-Id: I62500c10ccbbc68167f24e9d4fa49e85345d82c4

commit_message:
Add external network options to osc network set

The following patch adds the options "--external" & "--internal"
and the suboptions to "external": "--default" & "--no-default",
to "osc network set" CLI to provide the user an option to set
a network as an external network or remove the setting.

Change-Id: I3a7f2cb249bc8101cbb01322d7732e913237d6cd
Partial-Bug: #1545537

subject: make query for fixed bugs match more bugs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 09:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['release.sh'], 'message': 'make query for fixed bugs match more bugs

The git log is queried for the exact string "Closes-Bug:". It doesn't
take into account a lower case of that phrase or the usage of a space.

This change will match for :
* "Closes-Bug:"
* "Closes Bug:"
* "closes-bug:"
* "closes bug:"

For example, for Nova version 12.0.0..13.0.0 this means:
* before the change: 253 matches
* after the change: 302 matches

Change-Id: I0d5c411fc81d7c69a2ae326a13cb0de788da0787
'}]
commit_message:
make query for fixed bugs match more bugs

The git log is queried for the exact string "Closes-Bug:". It doesn't
take into account a lower case of that phrase or the usage of a space.

This change will match for :
* "Closes-Bug:"
* "Closes Bug:"
* "closes-bug:"
* "closes bug:"

For example, for Nova version 12.0.0..13.0.0 this means:
* before the change: 253 matches
* after the change: 302 matches

Change-Id: I0d5c411fc81d7c69a2ae326a13cb0de788da0787

commit_message:
Fix D401 PEP8 violation.

Currently tox ignores D401 (401: First line should be in imperative mood).
This change removes it and make keystoneauth docstring compliantwith it.

Change-Id: I136cf810f47c4c19f29216907a63f226930b5082
Partial-Bug: 1570049

subject: Fix retrieving VHDX block size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 16:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/storage/virtdisk/vhdutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/storage/virtdisk/test_vhdutils.py', 'os_win/utils/storage/virtdisk/virtdisk_constants.py'], 'message': 'Fix retrieving VHDX block size

We need the VHDX block size when retrieving the maximum internal
size of a VHDX for a specific file size.

The issue is that we rely on the virtdisk.dll API to give us this
value, while for fixed size images, the block size will always be
reported as 0.

This can easily be avoided by reintroducing the method which actually
parses the image file in order to retrieve the VHDX block size.

Closes-Bug: #1569451
Change-Id: Id035dbc070566817a60eed8270e39c52d3b54821
(cherry picked from commit a4e6cb7d4a46fe0a875d3427e4fd0ca83ee13ff9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving VHDX block size

We need the VHDX block size when retrieving the maximum internal
size of a VHDX for a specific file size.

The issue is that we rely on the virtdisk.dll API to give us this
value, while for fixed size images, the block size will always be
reported as 0.

This can easily be avoided by reintroducing the method which actually
parses the image file in order to retrieve the VHDX block size.

Closes-Bug: #1569451
Change-Id: Id035dbc070566817a60eed8270e39c52d3b54821
(cherry picked from commit a4e6cb7d4a46fe0a875d3427e4fd0ca83ee13ff9)

The blockquote font size is 17.5px in bootstrap where normal text is
14px. This is because blockquote is thought of for doing pull
quotes. However sphinx uses block quote for indented text, and it
should thus be the same as the body text.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I4135686416d84f5ca113a031534c3486a4c2b1c5
'}]
commit_message:
fix blockquote font size

The blockquote font size is 17.5px in bootstrap where normal text is
14px. This is because blockquote is thought of for doing pull
quotes. However sphinx uses block quote for indented text, and it
should thus be the same as the body text.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I4135686416d84f5ca113a031534c3486a4c2b1c5

subject: FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc'], 'message': 'FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims

The current FWaaS will fail pylint:
pylint runtests: commands[0] | pylint --rcfile=.pylintrc
--output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas
************* Module neutron_fwaas.db.firewall.firewall_db
W:621,12: Exception doesn't inherit from standard "Exception"
class (nonstandard-exception)
ERROR: InvocationError:
'/opt/stack/neutron-fwaas/.tox/pylint/bin/pylint
--rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas'

Looks like due to recent change
"FWaaS: make use of neutron_lib exceptions."
The culprit code:
   raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router['id'])
imports into fwaas from base Neutron as a neutron.common.exception,
not a neutron_lib.exceptions.

Quick investigation shows the neutron added following to .pylintrc:
neutron_lib shims
 nonstandard-exception,

Adding same to neutron_fwaas, complete with the TODO so will
remember to remove when neutron_lib shims are cleaned up.

Change-Id: I9bf2001e8c12038e152422051e2fb2a10214575c
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims

The current FWaaS will fail pylint:
pylint runtests: commands[0] | pylint --rcfile=.pylintrc
--output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas
************* Module neutron_fwaas.db.firewall.firewall_db
W:621,12: Exception doesn't inherit from standard "Exception"
class (nonstandard-exception)
ERROR: InvocationError:
'/opt/stack/neutron-fwaas/.tox/pylint/bin/pylint
--rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas'

Looks like due to recent change
"FWaaS: make use of neutron_lib exceptions."
The culprit code:
   raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router['id'])
imports into fwaas from base Neutron as a neutron.common.exception,
not a neutron_lib.exceptions.

Quick investigation shows the neutron added following to .pylintrc:
neutron_lib shims
 nonstandard-exception,

Adding same to neutron_fwaas, complete with the TODO so will
remember to remove when neutron_lib shims are cleaned up.

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I3341e13efc6011e5fc7354f7a0b0f0ede061b008
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Fix cinder volume stuck in swap_volume

When swap_volume is called, old_volume and new_volume are stuck
in 'detaching' and 'attaching' status respectively.

Added code in swap_volume api to attach new_volume and detach old_volume.

The bug that this patch fixes was caused by the following modification.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101933/

It removed attaching new_volume and detaching old_volume
in swap_volume method.
As a result, cinder migrate works well,
but nova swap_volume doesn't work.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia66b773b404a974486863bf3d21941d55cc4fdb9
Closes-Bug: #1471098

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 09:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/index.rst', 'api-ref/source/versions.inc', 'tox.ini', 'api-ref/source/servers.inc'], 'message': 'docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"

When building the docs or the api-ref, these warnings (among others)
will occur:

    api-ref/source/servers.rst:102: WARNING:
    duplicate label
    list-servers-lists-ids-names-and-links-for-all-servers-selector,
    other instance in ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst

    checking consistency...
    ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst::
    WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

This is due to the usage of ".. include::" in combination with the
"conf.py" setting "source_suffix = '.rst'". The duplicate detection
of sphinx will find then the labels twice, in "servers.rst" and also
"index.rst". Also sphinx doesn't find the *.rst files in any toctree.

The "include" directive got chosen to build one single document out of
multiple other documents (servers.rst + versions.rst). This change
alters the file extension of the included files to "*.inc", which
seems to be common practice of others who want to achive the same
result. This also solves the toctree warning. It keeps the "api-ref"
source open for other "*.rst" files which are not intented to be
included with the ".. included::" directive.

The commands "tox -e api-ref" and "tox -e docs" will now run without
warnings. Which enables us to also treat future warnings as errors,
hence the "tox.ini" build targets can use the "-W" flag.

To make the results reproducible, we remove previous build results
via "tox.ini" commands enhancement "rm -rf".

Change-Id: If9629aaa7b6743d056199f7f35bb67c4e21214c8
'}]
commit_message:
docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"

When building the docs or the api-ref, these warnings (among others)
will occur:

    api-ref/source/servers.rst:102: WARNING:
    duplicate label
    list-servers-lists-ids-names-and-links-for-all-servers-selector,
    other instance in ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst

    checking consistency...
    ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst::
    WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

This is due to the usage of ".. include::" in combination with the
"conf.py" setting "source_suffix = '.rst'". The duplicate detection
of sphinx will find then the labels twice, in "servers.rst" and also
"index.rst". Also sphinx doesn't find the *.rst files in any toctree.

The "include" directive got chosen to build one single document out of
multiple other documents (servers.rst + versions.rst). This change
alters the file extension of the included files to "*.inc", which
seems to be common practice of others who want to achive the same
result. This also solves the toctree warning. It keeps the "api-ref"
source open for other "*.rst" files which are not intented to be
included with the ".. included::" directive.

The commands "tox -e api-ref" and "tox -e docs" will now run without
warnings. Which enables us to also treat future warnings as errors,
hence the "tox.ini" build targets can use the "-W" flag.

To make the results reproducible, we remove previous build results
via "tox.ini" commands enhancement "rm -rf".

Change-Id: If9629aaa7b6743d056199f7f35bb67c4e21214c8

subject: Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:12:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'releasenotes/notes/inspection-wait-for-ips-223e39b65fef31bd.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_inspector.py', 'ironic_python_agent/inspector.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_ironic_api_client.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': "Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change makes inspection wait for *all* NIC's to get their IP addresses up
to a small timeout. The timeout is 60 seconds by default and can be changed
via the new ipa-inspection-dhcp-wait-timeout kernel option (0 to not wait).

After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

To avoid waiting for NIC's that are not even connected, this change extends the
NetworkInterface class with 'has_carrier' field.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
(cherry picked from commit 3deb25a3cec7955c5e38d83af74add58478f884c)
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change makes inspection wait for *all* NIC's to get their IP addresses up
to a small timeout. The timeout is 60 seconds by default and can be changed
via the new ipa-inspection-dhcp-wait-timeout kernel option (0 to not wait).

After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

To avoid waiting for NIC's that are not even connected, this change extends the
NetworkInterface class with 'has_carrier' field.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
(cherry picked from commit 3deb25a3cec7955c5e38d83af74add58478f884c)

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447
(cherry picked from commit 41580add20b20cb28dcacb5012c85a89cb46d830)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-02 07:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/migration-to-pluggable-ipam-bbc7eff9882c1a88.yaml', 'neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_migrate_ipam.py', 'neutron/cmd/migrate_ipam.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Add script for migrating to reference ipam driver

To be able to use pluggable ipam driver for greyfield deployments
a data migration script is needed. It populates information
from built-in ipam implementation to reference ipam driver.

Built-in ipam implementation uses next ipam related db models:
- Subnet
- IPAllocationPool
- IPAllocation
- IPAvailabilityRange
And reference ipam driver has counterpart models with similar scructure:
- IpamSubnet
- IpamAllocationPool
- IpamAllocation
- IpamAvailabilityRange
IpamSubnet has different ids comparing to Subnet model, so during data
migration remapping from neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id is needed.
IpamSubnet does not have index on neutron_subnet_id field, so joining
by this field would be extremely slow. To achieve O(1) time for lookup
neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id mapping is stored as a dict during
execution of migrate script.

Data migration can be done in both directions:
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' - migrates data from built-in to
  pluggable
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-built-in' - migrates data from pluggable to
  built-in

By default availability ranges are recalculated during migration.
It is done because source table that contains availability ranges can
become out-of-date in case of switching ipam backend multiple times.
All other 'built-in' ipam tables are receiving updates even
if pluggable ipam driver is used (these tables are API exposed and
still have to be updated).

Rebuilding availability ranges is slower than direct data copying.
If migration time is critical operator can specify '--quick' flag
to force direct data copying. This option applies only for
'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' script and it is safe to use only
if ipam backend is switched the first time.

Added release notes with steps to migrate from built-in ipam to
pluggable ipam.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now
neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable is called from alembic migration on
upgrade in gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

Change-Id: I257cd61cfbdcba42c35fbfddc257a216bf9a216f
Closes-Bug: #1516156
"}]
commit_message:
Add script for migrating to reference ipam driver

To be able to use pluggable ipam driver for greyfield deployments
a data migration script is needed. It populates information
from built-in ipam implementation to reference ipam driver.

Built-in ipam implementation uses next ipam related db models:
- Subnet
- IPAllocationPool
- IPAllocation
- IPAvailabilityRange
And reference ipam driver has counterpart models with similar scructure:
- IpamSubnet
- IpamAllocationPool
- IpamAllocation
- IpamAvailabilityRange
IpamSubnet has different ids comparing to Subnet model, so during data
migration remapping from neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id is needed.
IpamSubnet does not have index on neutron_subnet_id field, so joining
by this field would be extremely slow. To achieve O(1) time for lookup
neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id mapping is stored as a dict during
execution of migrate script.

Data migration can be done in both directions:
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' - migrates data from built-in to
  pluggable
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-built-in' - migrates data from pluggable to
  built-in

By default availability ranges are recalculated during migration.
It is done because source table that contains availability ranges can
become out-of-date in case of switching ipam backend multiple times.
All other 'built-in' ipam tables are receiving updates even
if pluggable ipam driver is used (these tables are API exposed and
still have to be updated).

Rebuilding availability ranges is slower than direct data copying.
If migration time is critical operator can specify '--quick' flag
to force direct data copying. This option applies only for
'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' script and it is safe to use only
if ipam backend is switched the first time.

Added release notes with steps to migrate from built-in ipam to
pluggable ipam.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now
neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable is called from alembic migration on
upgrade in gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

Change-Id: I257cd61cfbdcba42c35fbfddc257a216bf9a216f
Closes-Bug: #1516156

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447
(cherry picked from commit 41580add20b20cb28dcacb5012c85a89cb46d830)

commit_message:
Change release model for networking-ovn.

OVN itself is aiming for a production release in time for the OpenStack
Newton release.  We'd like to switch release models so that we're
releasing the Neutron plugin with the Newton release.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/091289.html

Change-Id: Id375d74ec487e0f2757cf3230ca3611a0b92285f
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: add scripts for performing YAML validation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 00:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/validate-yaml', 'ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook', 'ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit'], 'message': 'add scripts for performing YAML validation

this commit adds scripts for validating YAML documents, as well as a
wrapper for git pre-commit hooks.  The ci-scripts/validate-yaml
script will check individual files or entire directories, e.g:

    ./ci-scripts/validate-yaml playbooks

The ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook script is meant to be installed as a
git pre-commit hook:

    ln -s $PWD/ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook .git/hooks/pre-commit

This will run any executable scripts in `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d`.
There is one scripts there, `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit`, which will validate all of the .yml documents contained in a commit.  This can prevent CI failures do to simple syntax errors by ensuring that the yaml documents are correct before submitting a change to gerrit.

Change-Id: I088e7b56a066e9b8520af9d54489b8a61d8bc29b
'}]
commit_message:
add scripts for performing YAML validation

this commit adds scripts for validating YAML documents, as well as a
wrapper for git pre-commit hooks.  The ci-scripts/validate-yaml
script will check individual files or entire directories, e.g:

    ./ci-scripts/validate-yaml playbooks

The ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook script is meant to be installed as a
git pre-commit hook:

    ln -s $PWD/ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook .git/hooks/pre-commit

This will run any executable scripts in `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d`.
There is one scripts there, `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit`, which will validate all of the .yml documents contained in a commit.  This can prevent CI failures do to simple syntax errors by ensuring that the yaml documents are correct before submitting a change to gerrit.

Change-Id: I088e7b56a066e9b8520af9d54489b8a61d8bc29b

commit_message:
Remove global-requirements build from the build process

Currently the build process builds all the wheels for all packages
listed in OpenStack's global requirements.

This is a wasteful process as it contains packages needed by all
OpenStack projects, instead of just the projects OpenStack-Ansible
deploys in the integrated build.

This patch removes the wheel build of all global requirements and
switches the repo build process to only building the wheels that
are actually needed.

Depends-On: I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402
Change-Id: I5a865391803de2beef49c61b55277fad6317561f
(cherry picked from commit b70baeb461155993528c6e6209a8366b208a520d)

subject: update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 11:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['templates/op-venv-script.sh.j2', 'tasks/repo_build.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d9154a3a9df907a22ace30c4fc38dc2e53c5ded6)
'}]
commit_message:
update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d9154a3a9df907a22ace30c4fc38dc2e53c5ded6)

subject: Remove venv activation code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 11:23:45.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2', 'templates/keystone-wsgi.py.j2'], 'message': "Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1
(cherry picked from commit 36486b16b4ce1426b2021b8b84bdf0d9fb077334)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1
(cherry picked from commit 36486b16b4ce1426b2021b8b84bdf0d9fb077334)

subject: puppet: use gerrit-git-prep for all jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 02:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "puppet: use gerrit-git-prep for all jobs

Stop using zuul-clone macro because the other-requirements.txt was not
found by install-distro-packages.sh script, since it looks at the root
of the workspace.
By using gerrit-git-prep, we have the repo directly at the root of the
workspace, other-requirements.txt will be found and we'll unblock our
CI, that is currently broken because some packages are installed by
default bindep packages.

Change-Id: I5be52b5790655d4361817890f2bf4af382924e2c
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: use gerrit-git-prep for all jobs

Stop using zuul-clone macro because the other-requirements.txt was not
found by install-distro-packages.sh script, since it looks at the root
of the workspace.
By using gerrit-git-prep, we have the repo directly at the root of the
workspace, other-requirements.txt will be found and we'll unblock our
CI, that is currently broken because some packages are installed by
default bindep packages.

Change-Id: I5be52b5790655d4361817890f2bf4af382924e2c

subject: Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

commit_message:
Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for
us; these are installed by our Puppet modules or run_tests.sh script.

Change-Id: I96c733b03933cce04b0beee8952a2c49f83bb5b5

subject: Fix retrieving VM notes race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 15:41:39.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fix retrieving VM notes race condition

If the VM is deleted while we attempt to retrieve the VM notes, we
sometimes get a TypeError when we try to iterate over them, as the
Notes property will be set to None.

This change fixes the issue by storing this field in a different
variable, before attempting to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1569815

Change-Id: I89e73df9406a55e087751d20450e134be60867e6
(cherry picked from commit 70d3658d2635317bd785532c7d6fbc858ff05abe)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving VM notes race condition

If the VM is deleted while we attempt to retrieve the VM notes, we
sometimes get a TypeError when we try to iterate over them, as the
Notes property will be set to None.

This change fixes the issue by storing this field in a different
variable, before attempting to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1569815

Change-Id: I89e73df9406a55e087751d20450e134be60867e6
(cherry picked from commit 70d3658d2635317bd785532c7d6fbc858ff05abe)

commit_message:
Cinder verifies getting volume list with marker

Begin returning volumes that appear later in the
volume list than that represented by this volume id

Steps:
- Choosing a random volume from a list of volumes for
  'marker' parameter
- Running volume list using marker parameter
- Validating the expected list is the same like the
  observed list

Change-Id: Ibbf257bc1b270b79ce838ab7e724094934f2e3fa

commit_message:
Add ability to change roles during upgrade nodes

This change allows to specify new roles in the new environment using
the `--roles` option:

    $ octane upgrade-node --roles=<role1>,<role2> <env> <node1> <node2>

Change-Id: Ie4f6863047ba3a9bb76d7b22ceeaa70927ca9fc1
Depends-On: Iedb20a904e58f5b9a86eb47de8d8d317dc3cc61b

Change-Id: Idde0141691e1008bead802bd6f3759c12e37b02b

commit_message:
Adjust ansible-role-requirements-editor file open options

This implements more correct file open options. While this is
not strictly required it does appear to make the script behave
more consistently across different platforms.

The patch also renames the file name and related content to
ensure that the tool is correctly spelled.

Change-Id: Idde0141691e1008bead802bd6f3759c12e37b02b

commit_message:
Openswan/Libreswan: support sha256 for auth algorithm

Add support for sha256 as it is requirement from customer.
Currently, there is no ike/esp fields in strongswan ipsec.conf
template, so by default. sha256 is used. But for openswan auth
algorithm is get from configuration, so only sha1 is supported.
This patch enable Openswan/Libreswan to support sha256.

Note: this change is DocImpact and APIImpact

Change-Id: I02c80ec3494eb0edef2fdaa5d21ca0c3bbcacac2
Closes-Bug: #1567846

commit_message:
Fix totp test fails randomly

The test_with_multiple_users test would fail if the time happened to
roll over to the next chunk for the totp generator. The fix is to
control the clock in the test to this can't happen.

Change-Id: I2b92a0cc08ba8e36edc87cb76960a46746895458

commit_message:
Fix css references to the glyphicons font

The bootstrap css uses the glyphicons font, but sphinx can't put it
exactly in the same place that bootstrap wants it. So fix the
minimized css to make it available and include those fonts in our
tree.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: Ib45b90966ce12194fcb571c2782b1baed7af2471

commit_message:
Allow to upgrade nodes without re-provisioning

It's possible to reassign nodes from the upgrade environment to the seed
environment without re-provisioning.

    $ octane upgrade-node --no-provision <env> <node1> <node2>

Change-Id: I1fb88c6c7e0581034d8668373ecaa3ace2d085af
Depends-On: Iedb20a904e58f5b9a86eb47de8d8d317dc3cc61b

revisions:

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for

Change-Id: I96c733b03933cce04b0beee8952a2c49f83bb5b5
(cherry picked from commit 046de82d33a087ba140a9943fdf6fd13379591a7)

commit_message:
Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for
us; these are installed by our Puppet modules or run_tests.sh script.

Change-Id: I96c733b03933cce04b0beee8952a2c49f83bb5b5

commit_message:
Change Murano Glance Artifact Plugin location

Since this plugin is used only by Murano and this
plugin should be enabled by default, it's moved to
Murano settings section, which is hidden in case of
Murano is disabled.

Change-Id: I8ebac4405a1eaede18a35acbbab7b202b6aac754
Closes-Bug: #1569944

subject: ensure mysql defaults file is sourced
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-15 09:44:35.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f
'}]
commit_message:
ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f

commit_message:
Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for
us; these are installed by our Puppet modules or run_tests.sh script.

pin google-api-client to 0.9.4

google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0, so we need to pin to
0.9.4.

See https://github.com/google/google-api-ruby-client/issues/397

commit_message:
Fix cluster scaling operations

This patch fixes cluster scaling operations so that cluster's
desired_capacity will change no matter physical nodes are
created/deleted successfully or not. The desired capacity should be
changed provided the logical nodes are operated successfully.

Closes-Bug: 1537663
Change-Id: I29387e856fde86f001d212a5063f861bb57caeec
(cherry picked from commit 8d79ba257e0a14582b67eabd08667ba27b19cf40)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:16:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': "Removing previously created resources in pingtest and --skip-pingtest-cleanup option

If the pingtest fails in somepoint, images and network resources
are still created, in the case of pingtest images, they are created
with different ID's and when referencing the i.e. pingtest_image
by name, an error is returned as there are more than one image with the same
name.

This patch in the cleanup, removes all pingtest_* images.
And at the beginning of the overcloud_pingtest method
removes all the previous images or the nova network.

Also for debuging purposes a --skip-pingtest-cleanup option is added,
which allows not to delete the resources create in the pingtest

Change-Id: I10670af03510a7735433e37009e37c59fd0af3f4
Closes-Bug: #1569309
"}]
commit_message:
Removing previously created resources in pingtest and --skip-pingtest-cleanup option

If the pingtest fails in somepoint, images and network resources
are still created, in the case of pingtest images, they are created
with different ID's and when referencing the i.e. pingtest_image
by name, an error is returned as there are more than one image with the same
name.

This patch in the cleanup, removes all pingtest_* images.
And at the beginning of the overcloud_pingtest method
removes all the previous images or the nova network.

Also for debuging purposes a --skip-pingtest-cleanup option is added,
which allows not to delete the resources create in the pingtest

Change-Id: I10670af03510a7735433e37009e37c59fd0af3f4
Closes-Bug: #1569309

commit_message:
Add job to test Nova with specific libvirt and kvm packages

Nova has sometimes the need to exploit features of libvirt which
are not yet in the default libvirt version of our testing
infrastructure.
This change adds a test job which is able to set up a devstack node
which runs with specific libvirt and kvm packages.

Change-Id: Ifd231857cffd134e911225088d6dc65bf61fdedd

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447

commit_message:
Fix dimension validation of alarms

Dimension key & value pair have ':' delimiter, not '='.
And Fix dimension multi value problem.

Enhance the assert message from ErrorMessages to make it easier to
see why tests failed

Change-Id: Ia131b2caaa5d219f427e4976011ef22075e16038

commit_message:
FIX installation to enable to install after unstack

Some commands of installation fail when executing after unstack,
because the resouces are remained after unstack.
This patch avoids this situation by allowing the commands to fail and
checking the existence of directories.

Change-Id: I337de2b931b58f4e4cd3d5570f6752cc3f8c1dbd
Closes-Bug: 1569149

subject: StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 11:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_update.py', 'tripleo_common/update.py'], 'message': 'StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

Change-Id: I5e7eb522521d985f374db91e7258e5b474b6b2c9
Related-Bug: #1567384
Related-Bug: #1567385
'}]
commit_message:
StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

Change-Id: I5e7eb522521d985f374db91e7258e5b474b6b2c9
Related-Bug: #1567384
Related-Bug: #1567385

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 12:23:45.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Unset UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale, pass in StackAction

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

So we clear UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale to make sure that package
update doesn't get triggered, and we pass new StackAction parameter to
allow us to correctly distinguish between create vs. update of the
top-level stack, and condition the pacemaker restarts on this variable
instead.

Change-Id: I9dc3b4cd8a6a71df34d8babf0e4c6505041f5311
Related-Bug: #1567384
Closes-Bug: #1567385
'}]
commit_message:
Unset UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale, pass in StackAction

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

So we clear UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale to make sure that package
update doesn't get triggered, and we pass new StackAction parameter to
allow us to correctly distinguish between create vs. update of the
top-level stack, and condition the pacemaker restarts on this variable
instead.

Change-Id: I9dc3b4cd8a6a71df34d8babf0e4c6505041f5311
Related-Bug: #1567384
Closes-Bug: #1567385

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 03:47:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Fix random failure of security group unit test

CLITestV20SecurityGroupsJSON.test_extend_list_exceed_max_uri_len
fails randomly because this test uses query parameters and
the order of query parameters in a construct URL is not deterministic.
As a result the test failed randomly.
The test should use MyUrlComparator to compare URLs.
MyUrlComparator ignores the order parameters when comparing URLs.

Change-Id: I8a8116f45583102fa1351d17a1cc5174bdce3cc9
Closes-Bug: #1570689
'}]
commit_message:
Fix random failure of security group unit test

CLITestV20SecurityGroupsJSON.test_extend_list_exceed_max_uri_len
fails randomly because this test uses query parameters and
the order of query parameters in a construct URL is not deterministic.
As a result the test failed randomly.
The test should use MyUrlComparator to compare URLs.
MyUrlComparator ignores the order parameters when comparing URLs.

Change-Id: I8a8116f45583102fa1351d17a1cc5174bdce3cc9
Closes-Bug: #1570689

commit_message:
Update hiera_config to parse plugins as a list of hashes

Plugins are listed in hiera now with the following format:
- plugins:
  - name: pluginname
    repositories:
      - name: plugin-name-1.0
        priority: 1100
        ...
   - name: plugin2
   ...

It is necessary to update how hiera_config finds plugin names
because they are stored in the name key now.

Change-Id: I67b06b46d56892bfab3d39cd98bee35bfdac06a0
Partial-Bug: #1565061
(cherry picked from commit 06707b792c7104d6340359631e41cf17105897a5)
(cherry picked from commit cc6f3274e03e8ad8cf60da9d15c096353a07515a)

subject: neutron: pci_request logic considers 'direct-physical' vnic type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 11:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/pci/request.py'], 'message': "neutron: pci_request logic considers 'direct-physical' vnic type

Since the following change:

If1ab969c2002c649a3d51635ca2765c262e2d37f

Neutron supports this vnic type, which ties in with the work that
enabled PF passthrough.

This patch makes sure to properly translate the 'direct-physical'
vnic-type port from Neutron to a request for a PF.

Change-Id: I51af36fc2edca3404a8f9efb32462f3680944be1
Partially-Implements: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit 969a0c5a3037dd02a2d9682cd42ca400a97aefe3)
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: pci_request logic considers 'direct-physical' vnic type

Since the following change:

If1ab969c2002c649a3d51635ca2765c262e2d37f

Neutron supports this vnic type, which ties in with the work that
enabled PF passthrough.

This patch makes sure to properly translate the 'direct-physical'
vnic-type port from Neutron to a request for a PF.

Change-Id: I51af36fc2edca3404a8f9efb32462f3680944be1
Partially-Implements: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit 969a0c5a3037dd02a2d9682cd42ca400a97aefe3)

commit_message:
Set db connection retry to infinity

Make sure that all the sevices will attempt to
connect to the database an infinite about of times.
If the database ever disappears for some reason we
want the services to try and reconnect more than just
10 times.

Closes-bug: #1505636
Change-Id: I77abbf72ce5bfd68faa451bb9a72bd2544963f4b
(cherry picked from commit 67333e4dd16f464c758735e1b6f58f87eac53b81)

commit_message:
Install qemu-image from backports repo

qemu-image has been installed from testing to fix issues when
qemu-img can't convert image:
qemu-img: error writing zeroes at sector 0: Invalid argument

The issue has been fixed in qemu 2.2.0-rc2, reference [0].

Which has been added to debian backports.

This patch fixes issue with building coreos image, when qemu-utils
can't be installed from testing due to dependency problems.

Reference:
[0] http://git.qemu-project.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commitdiff;h=f3a9cfddae
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1389728

Change-Id: Ie62a88e1d012aba1392b19c18137529c4c3ebf31
Related-Bug: #1490086
Closes-bug: #1570090
Closes-Bug: #1569835
(cherry picked from commit 52066d0a4920d2ccb3c6aef165e4a843ede4a809)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-15 11:43:02.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make the ceph devstack-plugin-based job gating on Nova

This gets us back to gating on working ceph bits. The job has been
stable for quite some time now (over a month) and the only ceph-specific
failures have been actual regressions we have let into the tree because
this is not gating. We know this because we have a team of nova and
cinder people now monitoring status on a daily basis.

Change-Id: If97adae3fdbb823f0c7f6c01da96355afede4605
'}]
commit_message:
Make the ceph devstack-plugin-based job gating on Nova

This gets us back to gating on working ceph bits. The job has been
stable for quite some time now (over a month) and the only ceph-specific
failures have been actual regressions we have let into the tree because
this is not gating. We know this because we have a team of nova and
cinder people now monitoring status on a daily basis.

Change-Id: If97adae3fdbb823f0c7f6c01da96355afede4605

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 10:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'neutron: Update the port with a MAC address for PFs

In case of an SR-IOV PF as a neutron port, we should really update
Neutron with the proper MAC, as it is known only once the instance has
claimed a device on the compute host.

This patch adds a local Neutron API method that will grab the MAC
address based on the claimed device, and pass it on with the binding
port updates that happen during network allocation.

Change-Id: I7eafcaa9147bb9cbe7c7c8cda34ec259be0b0eb5
Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit ca9f12a9994ad9f10711301837beeb81cb851298)
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: Update the port with a MAC address for PFs

In case of an SR-IOV PF as a neutron port, we should really update
Neutron with the proper MAC, as it is known only once the instance has
claimed a device on the compute host.

This patch adds a local Neutron API method that will grab the MAC
address based on the claimed device, and pass it on with the binding
port updates that happen during network allocation.

Change-Id: I7eafcaa9147bb9cbe7c7c8cda34ec259be0b0eb5
Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit ca9f12a9994ad9f10711301837beeb81cb851298)

Refactor magic_search.js to support strict DI mode.

magic_search.js should be refactor to support strict DI mode, otherwise
it will block magic search box feature in horizon dashboard.

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox and remove py33

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.
Also, as per Infra, py33 support would be removed from Mitaka, so
taking care of the same as well in this patch.

Change-Id: Ib16b7070b263c19bb0439ece3efa9b33cbd1d2cc
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ief1349910375a0c5ee65823801db6b5f84619154
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Fix cluster scaling operations

This patch fixes cluster scaling operations so that cluster's
desired_capacity will change no matter physical nodes are
created/deleted successfully or not. The desired capacity should be
changed provided the logical nodes are operated successfully.

Closes-Bug: 1537663
Change-Id: I29387e856fde86f001d212a5063f861bb57caeec

subject: update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-11 01:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['templates/op-venv-script.sh.j2', 'tasks/repo_build.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 10:38:52.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2', 'templates/keystone-wsgi.py.j2'], 'message': "Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1

commit_message:
Add test for different amount of pinned CPU

This testgroup should be run with this parameters:

export KVM_USE=True
export SLAVE_NODE_CPU=6
export DRIVER_ENABLE_ACPI=true
export NUMA_NODES=2

Change-Id: Ida99b43992c854db33eab8c60ca52b0b73297f08
Implements: blueprint test-numa-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add exceptions hierarchy

nailgun.errors have a huge set of exceptions but without hierarchy. This
patch remove exception generation from dict and make it explicitly with
python classes and add some exceptions hierarchy. Now all network errors
inherit from NetworkException and same for other exceptions.

Change-Id: I9a2c6b358ea02a16711da74562308664ad7aed97
Closes-bug: #1566195

subject: Use network space binding for shared-db relation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-13 10:29:01.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/heat_relations.py', 'unit_tests/test_heat_relations.py', 'README.md'], 'message': "Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: Ic49f16c8ccceeb5aa25a2197a92767dc5aacf703
"}]
commit_message:
Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: Ic49f16c8ccceeb5aa25a2197a92767dc5aacf703

commit_message:
Isolate scenario args between iterations

We have several scenarios which modifies input data. Iterations of such
scenarios are not isolated between each other.

Also, this patch returns NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_ports scenario
from unstable to regular job.

Change-Id: Ifa5d5ecd04507edb00e9befa1c7add075010258c

commit_message:
Metrics tracking for TripleO deployment tasks

Track wall time metrics for:
 -tripleo.undercloud.install.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.images.seconds
 -tripleo.register.nodes.seconds
 -tripleo.introspect.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.deploy.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.settle.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.ping_test.seconds
 -tripleo.testenv.wait.seconds
 -tripleo.ci.total.seconds

Additionally we track the image size in MB for:
 -tripleo.overcloud.image.size_mb

Currently sending these to Dan's graphite server.

Change-Id: I9307ca50bf5fb8398fd22ccbe45e79524b8837c8

commit_message:
Make sure openstack services are dependent on openstack-core

Previously ceilometer-notification, aodh-listener and sahara-engine
didn't have constraints that would anchor them under openstack-core
dummy resource. Such constraints are added now. (sahara-engine starting
after sahara-api, aodh-listener after aodh-evaluator, and
ceilometer-notification after openstack-core.) Openstack-core ->
heat-api constraint has been removed because heat-api depends on
ceilometer-notification, so there's a transitive dependency on
openstack-core already.

Change-Id: Ided7321ebbf2c3556726343b4bb466fd8759b43a
Closes-Bug: #1569444

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not validate DPDK availability. It's always
calculated on the fly.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ibaf7919ac0068cdb6a1be93b74ebc0c4886ac934
Partial-Bug: #1564102
(cherry picked from commit 2a49a61a9d9ab3617872d223d516928255537d80)

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I1abacf8b52357adec27d281e48375fb67253464d
(cherry picked from commit d67ccaf7baf7beb7ea3559c84ae0c645d0452dd8)

3) Align git branches for tests

commit_message:
This patch include 3 other patches

1) Fixed building patch for saving deployment info

   Since 9.0 the deployment info is serialized only per node.

2) Adapt tests for new re-deployment logic

   Deployment logic was changed in [1] to start deployment
   tasks even if there are no changes to be deployed.

   This patch updates functional tests accordingly.

   1. I4a6f5f37161e4290050ec4926cf029cd7af566e4

3) Align git branches for tests

   We need to use stable/mitaka branch both in python-fuelclient
   and fuel-web

   Switching to full repo cloning since for now we need
   checkout to other branches

Change-Id: I2975a203a19c77ab2f31cb5413dc22e1417321ac

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-14 18:53:57.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd

commit_message:
Neutron API evolution strategy

This specification discusses, in a very boring and pedant
way, a plan for moving away from extensions as a way to
evolve the API and introduce micro versioning as it has
already been done for Nova and Ironic.

Since, it is very boring, read only if properly caffeinated
(or if you are trying to get asleep).

DocImpact
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I7674147172baec42cf3ee03f13ef4e4255586447

commit_message:
Keep setting backend_host to 'hostgroup' for rbd backends

There are backwards incompatible patches [1][2] in puppet-cinder which break
upgrade scenarios, but at this point they made it to liberty and mitaka,
so workaround in t-h-t is easier than revert

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209412/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231068/

Change-Id: Ic82258bf0893ebd4e595e5df73ffbc4c6443f9e8
Closes-Bug: #1570265
(cherry picked from commit 2b15978ba0ef9843345db18aabb2f999d4535381)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-11 16:42:18.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/couchdb-replication.rst'], 'message': "Enable CouchDB replication in Trove

One of the key features of CouchDB is it's ability to replicate a
single database from a source to a target system. Although CouchDB
is a supported datastore in Trove, the replication feature hasn't
been implemented. This spec describes how we can implement CouchDB
replication in Trove.

Change-Id: I1daf2dd6fddab82b0cf007f410d4ce4c68d69571
Implements: blueprint couchdb-replication
"}]
commit_message:
Enable CouchDB replication in Trove

One of the key features of CouchDB is it's ability to replicate a
single database from a source to a target system. Although CouchDB
is a supported datastore in Trove, the replication feature hasn't
been implemented. This spec describes how we can implement CouchDB
replication in Trove.

Change-Id: I1daf2dd6fddab82b0cf007f410d4ce4c68d69571
Implements: blueprint couchdb-replication

commit_message:
Install qemu-image from backports repo

qemu-image has been installed from testing to fix issues when
qemu-img can't convert image:
qemu-img: error writing zeroes at sector 0: Invalid argument

The issue has been fixed in qemu 2.2.0-rc2, reference [0].

Which has been added to debian backports.

This patch fixes issue with building coreos image, when qemu-utils
can't be installed from testing due to dependency problems.

Reference:
[0] http://git.qemu-project.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commitdiff;h=f3a9cfddae
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1389728

Change-Id: Ie62a88e1d012aba1392b19c18137529c4c3ebf31
Related-Bug: #1490086
Closes-bug: #1570090
Closes-Bug: #1569835

subject: Support the LibreSwan driver in Red Hat platforms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 11:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/vpnaas.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_vpnaas_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Support the LibreSwan driver in Red Hat platforms

Currently, the libreswan package is supported by puppet-neutron as
part of the openswan driver. However, there is a specific libreswan
driver, which is required when using it (see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1444017 for details).

Adding support for the LibreSwan driver in puppet-neutron, only for
Red Hat platforms as it does not seem to be supported in Debian/Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I9628e485d301734f9d739c1d03d6da9f7887c61d
'}]
commit_message:
Support the LibreSwan driver in Red Hat platforms

Currently, the libreswan package is supported by puppet-neutron as
part of the openswan driver. However, there is a specific libreswan
driver, which is required when using it (see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1444017 for details).

Adding support for the LibreSwan driver in puppet-neutron, only for
Red Hat platforms as it does not seem to be supported in Debian/Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I9628e485d301734f9d739c1d03d6da9f7887c61d
