revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 08:17:29.000000000', 'files': ['cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_centos.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_7.0_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_6.1_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_8.0_ubuntu.jinja2'], 'message': "Ensure mcollective is purged

When mcollective started by the system before cloud-init starts
to reconfigure it subsequent 'service mcollective start' does
effectively nothing leaving mcollective service running with
default config.
The best solution would be to fix cloudinit so that it would
restart mcollective after its config is changed rather than
just start it.
Another solution would be to stop mcollective service before
cloudinit starts to change its config. This solution is almost
impossible to implement - exact time must be chosen.
So, the only solution left is to brutally remove mcollective
package so that it wouldn't start and cloudinit installs
it later.

Change-Id: Id9f10b3b07eb59b21a79b799532121897164f80f
Closes-Bug: #1455489
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure mcollective is purged

When mcollective started by the system before cloud-init starts
to reconfigure it subsequent 'service mcollective start' does
effectively nothing leaving mcollective service running with
default config.
The best solution would be to fix cloudinit so that it would
restart mcollective after its config is changed rather than
just start it.
Another solution would be to stop mcollective service before
cloudinit starts to change its config. This solution is almost
impossible to implement - exact time must be chosen.
So, the only solution left is to brutally remove mcollective
package so that it wouldn't start and cloudinit installs
it later.

Change-Id: Id9f10b3b07eb59b21a79b799532121897164f80f
Closes-Bug: #1455489

commit_message:
[CI] Move cinder scenarios to cinder job from neutron_unstable

We have separated non voting cinder job that should test all cinder
plugins. Previously it was in neutron_unstalbe job that was used
for all unstable scenarios, so they won't block the gates.

Change-Id: I7329190031d265002b7e286cee1dcb462d94125e

commit_message:
Translate properties before update

This adds the translation rule call to properties before update, so that
we can remove resource code that refers to deprecated properties. The
new ones are used everywhere with the expectation that the translation
occurred.

Change-Id: Ibdf91ae711f82de5c60896f2452e2872bb3dc9cb
Closes-Bug: #1518676
(cherry picked from commit 003df61ae026174d27b2c44a63527ab93ccc4ac1)

commit_message:
Add support for CouchDB Replication

This implementation includes a strategy for bi-directional replication
for CouchDB. The following replication related commands have been
implemented for CouchDB:
- create (with replica_of and replica_count arguments)
- detach-replica
- promote-to-replica-source

Change-Id: Ic2406d90b3ddc4dd287d68d0bbac3a9d093cc6b2
Implements: blueprint couchdb-replication

subject: Ensure mcollective is purged
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 07:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_centos.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_7.0_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_6.1_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_ubuntu.jinja2', 'cloud-init-templates/cloud_config_fuel_8.0_ubuntu.jinja2'], 'message': "Ensure mcollective is purged

When mcollective started by the system before cloud-init starts
to reconfigure it subsequent 'service mcollective start' does
effectively nothing leaving mcollective service running with
default config.
The best solution would be to fix cloudinit so that it would
restart mcollective after its config is changed rather than
just start it.
Another solution would be to stop mcollective service before
cloudinit starts to change its config. This solution is almost
impossible to implement - exact time must be chosen.
So, the only solution left is to brutally remove mcollective
package so that it wouldn't start and cloudinit installs
it later.

Change-Id: Iba5dd2c022ed6185a16649994a60f1bd417f0f2e
Closes-Bug: #1455489
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure mcollective is purged

When mcollective started by the system before cloud-init starts
to reconfigure it subsequent 'service mcollective start' does
effectively nothing leaving mcollective service running with
default config.
The best solution would be to fix cloudinit so that it would
restart mcollective after its config is changed rather than
just start it.
Another solution would be to stop mcollective service before
cloudinit starts to change its config. This solution is almost
impossible to implement - exact time must be chosen.
So, the only solution left is to brutally remove mcollective
package so that it wouldn't start and cloudinit installs
it later.

Change-Id: Iba5dd2c022ed6185a16649994a60f1bd417f0f2e
Closes-Bug: #1455489

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-14 17:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron.yaml'], 'message': "Switch gate-neutron-dsvm-api to be invoked via tempest plugin framework

Neutron was amongst one of the earliest projects that promoted the
idea of colocating more advanced tests within the project's source
repo itself. The job gate-neutron-dsvm-api was created out of the
tempest backbone when no plugin/tempest-lib were a thing. Things
have matured since, therefore it is time to update some of the
plumbing underpinning this job so that we can start using some of
the latest cool stuff that Tempest has to offer.

The switch must be made conditional to branches since the it only
makes sense from Newton onward.

Depends-on: Ia233aa162746845f6ae08a8157dcd242dcd58eab
Change-Id: If5f7ea82c45494953452f728fabb7403d0b6e14e
"}]
commit_message:
Switch gate-neutron-dsvm-api to be invoked via tempest plugin framework

Neutron was amongst one of the earliest projects that promoted the
idea of colocating more advanced tests within the project's source
repo itself. The job gate-neutron-dsvm-api was created out of the
tempest backbone when no plugin/tempest-lib were a thing. Things
have matured since, therefore it is time to update some of the
plumbing underpinning this job so that we can start using some of
the latest cool stuff that Tempest has to offer.

The switch must be made conditional to branches since the it only
makes sense from Newton onward.

Depends-on: Ia233aa162746845f6ae08a8157dcd242dcd58eab
Change-Id: If5f7ea82c45494953452f728fabb7403d0b6e14e

subject: Use pybabel instead of python setup.py, enable sync
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-15 05:05:17.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Use pybabel instead of python setup.py, enable sync

We use already pybabel for django projects, let's use it also for python
projects. This works around a bug in Babel 2.3.3 with keyword option
parsing and unifies on using pybabel for both python and django.

Also extract the installation of horizon so that it's only done once for
modules that have multiple django modules.

This change uses Babel 2.2.0 now but works with 2.3.3 as well.

Reenable syncing of translation.

Change-Id: Ie220fc9418ae31941d182885e44237dc7fafe10a
"}]
commit_message:
Use pybabel instead of python setup.py, enable sync

We use already pybabel for django projects, let's use it also for python
projects. This works around a bug in Babel 2.3.3 with keyword option
parsing and unifies on using pybabel for both python and django.

Also extract the installation of horizon so that it's only done once for
modules that have multiple django modules.

This change uses Babel 2.2.0 now but works with 2.3.3 as well.

Reenable syncing of translation.

Change-Id: Ie220fc9418ae31941d182885e44237dc7fafe10a

subject: Fix circular dependency  of certificate_manager module
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7764, 'name': 'Peter Hamilton', 'email': 'peter.hamilton@jhuapl.edu', 'username': 'Peter'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 16046, 'name': 'Fernando Diaz', 'email': 'diazjf@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'diazjf'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-14 12:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/tasks/test_certificate_resources.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_certificate_manager.py', 'barbican/tasks/certificate_resources.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix circular dependency  of certificate_manager module

The certificate_manager module had a circular dependency that made it
problematic to use for certain versions of the python interpreter.
This was because we were initializing a singleton EVENT_PLUGIN_MANAGER
that in turn loaded the plugins; The problem was that the plugins
imported certificate_manger themselves and this caused the circular
dependency. So instead of creating that class in the module, I
created a function that should be called instead.

Closes-Bug: #1570356
Change-Id: I9cdb7c3ecc9c275ee561363f6ce13248259f88d0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix circular dependency  of certificate_manager module

The certificate_manager module had a circular dependency that made it
problematic to use for certain versions of the python interpreter.
This was because we were initializing a singleton EVENT_PLUGIN_MANAGER
that in turn loaded the plugins; The problem was that the plugins
imported certificate_manger themselves and this caused the circular
dependency. So instead of creating that class in the module, I
created a function that should be called instead.

Closes-Bug: #1570356
Change-Id: I9cdb7c3ecc9c275ee561363f6ce13248259f88d0

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated from the oslo.log
library. Its value may be silently ignored in the future. If this option
is not set explicitly, there is no such warning.

Furthermore, the default value of verbose is true, so there is no
need to set this value in config files.

Change-Id: If760c42da26aefe49ae52415941e6146bcbccb6a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated option 'DEFAULT/verbose'

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated from the oslo.log
library. Its value may be silently ignored in the future. If this option
is not set explicitly, there is no such warning.

Furthermore, the default value of verbose is true, so there is no
need to set this value in config files.

Change-Id: If760c42da26aefe49ae52415941e6146bcbccb6a

commit_message:
Ensure mcollective is stopped

When mcollective started by the system before cloud-init starts
to reconfigure it subsequent 'service mcollective start' does
effectively nothing leaving mcollective service running with
default config.
Stopping it before reconfiguration fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ic9806e4a0a406f701091d3f7cc7ec77c8dbd9029
Closes-Bug: #1455489

commit_message:
[WIP] datasource pub-sub on new bus

Preliminary implementation of reliable pub-sub over unreliable bus.
Datasource stamps each pub with a sequence number.
Policy engine keeps received updates in a queue and processes them
in order of sequence number.

Out of order updates are reordered.
Duplicate updates are ignored.
Dropped/missing updates are identified.

Testing accomplished by unit tests in test_agnostic as well as functional
tests in test_dse and tests/datasources/*

Note this patch is only here for reference and for feedback.
I do not intend to merge this patch.
Instead, Peter Balland and I expect to put this functionality into the new
dse2.DataService class (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/267227/).

Partially implements blueprint: dist-datasources-on-bus

Change-Id: Id511f2fa867ba120440089c8244efdbc1810a9fb

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-14 13:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/magnum/test_bay.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/magnum/bay.py'], 'message': "Magnum::Bay observe reality implementation

Override parse_live_resource_data method for Magnum::Bay resource
to observe and update resource plugin with live state.
Also, default values for node_count and master_count were added,
because if a user doesn't set them we decide that there is a diff
between heat properties and reality and send unnecessary update.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I2cd19fe7b88b4e24798a3baf7cfa3c0ec2cccbb2
"}]
commit_message:
Magnum::Bay observe reality implementation

Override parse_live_resource_data method for Magnum::Bay resource
to observe and update resource plugin with live state.
Also, default values for node_count and master_count were added,
because if a user doesn't set them we decide that there is a diff
between heat properties and reality and send unnecessary update.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I2cd19fe7b88b4e24798a3baf7cfa3c0ec2cccbb2

subject: Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 00:55:06.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I0cf9ada1110f6b1452480039c136aee1fc3ccc82

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I0cf9ada1110f6b1452480039c136aee1fc3ccc82
Depends-On: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
Depends-On: I07accff0914b93be09adf17a2552c5c922236c2e
(cherry picked from commit d67ccaf7baf7beb7ea3559c84ae0c645d0452dd8)

commit_message:
Provide single step check if eventlet is monkey_patched

Currently to perform such check we need to check if eventlet
is available first, that give us two steps, but it is
desired to check this at once.

This change is to remove the function here:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_commons.py#L37
Also will be useful in zmq-driver.

Change-Id: Ie24ecb54946bfba465d293185ebfda25691a8701

commit_message:
Add installation support for os_ironic

This patch adds the initial support for the ironic role in
openstack-ansible, but leaves ironic unconfigured and not
installed by default.

Configuration, including Nova configuration, will be addressed in
subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Id9f01deb5c46ee2186b9c41c7f88205560b5f437
Depends-On: Ide66c7ee59192ac441ac2919028eca0ad665ceea

In flanneld version 0.5.4(on fedora-atomic-23 iamge), the default flannel
etcd key changed from /coreos.com/network to /atomic.io/network.

Use $FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY in /etc/sysconfig/flanneld for debugging.

Change-Id: I13e26061b7a6b33878f90834eacde9c4bc6e72d7
'}]
commit_message:
Doc: fix flannel etcd key

In flanneld version 0.5.4(on fedora-atomic-23 iamge), the default flannel
etcd key changed from /coreos.com/network to /atomic.io/network.

Use $FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY in /etc/sysconfig/flanneld for debugging.

Change-Id: I13e26061b7a6b33878f90834eacde9c4bc6e72d7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 18:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/osc/v1/stack.py'], 'message': 'Moved -t parameter for visibility

When called without the required arguments, the allowed arguments are
output to the screen. The order of those arguments is dictated by when
they are added to the parser.

Before this change, -t (a required parameter) was at the start of the
list. This obfuscated the required parameter list when the help output
was displayed:

usage: openstack stack create [-h]
                              [-f
{html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}]

[--noindent]

commit_message:
Moved -t parameter for visibility

When called without the required arguments, the allowed arguments are
output to the screen. The order of those arguments is dictated by when
they are added to the parser.

Before this change, -t (a required parameter) was at the start of the
list. This obfuscated the required parameter list when the help output
was displayed:

usage: openstack stack create [-h]
                              [-f
{html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}]
                              [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
[--noindent]
                              [--prefix PREFIX] -t <template>
                              [-e <environment>] [--timeout <timeout>]
                              [--pre-create <resource>]
[--enable-rollback]
                              [--parameter <key=value>]
                              [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--wait]
                              [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--dry-run]
                              <stack-name>

Notice how the -t appears in the middle of the optional arguments. This
change moves it to the end so that it is more easily visible to the user
what is required:

usage: openstack stack create [-h]
                              [-f
{html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}]
                              [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
[--noindent]
                              [--prefix PREFIX] [-e <environment>]
                              [--timeout <timeout>] [--pre-create
<resource>]
                              [--enable-rollback] [--parameter
<key=value>]
                              [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--wait]
                              [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--dry-run]
                              -t <template>
                              <stack-name>

Change-Id: I4e17650622dc8e206dc1aa39e4102f16429ac353

commit_message:
Optionally allow autocomplete in Horizon

Horizon disables password autocompletion by default. This causes
problems for users who use password managers and want to store
their Horizon credentials. This patch adds a variable that allows
a deployer to override this default.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I8eaa5a1773e6f182c436b312f2733a21505a867c
Closes-Bug: 1570505
(cherry picked from commit 8667dce5e13af1bf59caf6b0025ee62ab4265933)

commit_message:
cleanup-host should not remove kolla-build.conf

new cleanup-host script removes kolla-build.conf
in /etc/kolla directory which contains the build
configuration for building images.
This should be preserved.

subject: Drop use of neutron-plugin-metering-agent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-14 10:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/neutron_utils.py'], 'message': 'Drop use of neutron-plugin-metering-agent

As the minimum OpenStack release supported is now Icehouse
which provided the neutron-metering-agent package, switch
to using this by default for ovs and ovs-odl plugin types.

Resolves install failures for ovs-odl on Xenial/Mitaka where
the neutron-plugin-metering-agent transitional package has
been removed.

Change-Id: I431bef69b597bc9c55ed6f4c35552e6f1b707d30
'}]
commit_message:
Drop use of neutron-plugin-metering-agent

As the minimum OpenStack release supported is now Icehouse
which provided the neutron-metering-agent package, switch
to using this by default for ovs and ovs-odl plugin types.

Resolves install failures for ovs-odl on Xenial/Mitaka where
the neutron-plugin-metering-agent transitional package has
been removed.

Change-Id: I431bef69b597bc9c55ed6f4c35552e6f1b707d30

subject: pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 19:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/token_logs_file-d002e669303b0555.yaml', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files

keystone-manage tool is not able yet [1] to write in a specific log file
or in syslog.
Until it's done in Keystone, change the way we run the Execs in Puppet
so we can redirect the output in the log files that we want.

Do it for both pki & fernet log files.

Note: a unit tests was duplicated, it has been replace by a new test for
PKI with non-default value for pki_logs_file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1570463

Change-Id: If5b54f183408acedc42ac5c3fdeb08df0cfa1e31
"}]
commit_message:
pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files

keystone-manage tool is not able yet [1] to write in a specific log file
or in syslog.
Until it's done in Keystone, change the way we run the Execs in Puppet
so we can redirect the output in the log files that we want.

Do it for both pki & fernet log files.

Note: a unit tests was duplicated, it has been replace by a new test for
PKI with non-default value for pki_logs_file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1570463

Change-Id: If5b54f183408acedc42ac5c3fdeb08df0cfa1e31

commit_message:
Get revocation list with only audit ids

A new audit_id_only argument is added to get_revoked which if True
requests that the server return audit IDs and not token IDs.

Closes-Bug: 1317302
Change-Id: I6c40f1ed32f102006c881e80f9ef0025a9d8709b

commit_message:
Resolve Gate failure

Recent change in tempest of using urllib3 instead of httplib2
causing our gate to fail. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: Ia966cfaaeaff97bdc156c767ba39c7136328413f
